PRBs (max=273)
A: 1 section ………..
B: 2 sections ………
… … ……
D: 6 sections………. * * * *
C: 2 sections w/gap**
E: 2 symbols
2 sections ……….
F: 3 symbols
complex …………
* * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * *
* marks PRBs with reMask NOT all ones
** white -colored PRBs represent empty PRBs
  1
Figure 3.2.1.1-2 Stock Data Section Definition for both DL and UL 2
 3
There is also “stock” U-Plane data that is PN23 data, representing user data prior to modulation, as specified within 4
3GPP 38.14138.141-1[CCITT Recommendation O.151 (10/92): https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-O.151-199210-I/en] 5
which is assumed to start at a frame boundary and be identical in all frames in both DL and UL, unless a sp ecific test 6
states differently.  The PN sequence is expected to be running for the duration of the frame for whatever is the 7
bandwidth and SCS (this is different from how the data sections are handled, wherein the data sections are truncated 8
based on the number of PRBs per symbol).  However, in many cases only some symbols within a frame will be actually 9
subject to testing (as defined by the specific tests) so will contain the test PN sequence data; the remaining symbols are 10
expected to remain undefined for the test and may contain data according to the normal operation of the O-DU (e.g. set 11
to carry synch or reference signals consistent with LTE or NR).  Note that the PN sequence initial value is provided by 12
a seed which may be included as a Test Command parameter. If the parameter is omitted the PN sequence generator 13
will use a “seed” value of all ones. 14
For all tests, the test definition shall define the specific slots and symbols subject to test (carrying the “stock” C-Plane 15
data section definition and the “stock” U-Plane data) with the remaining slots and symbols undefined but carrying 16
normal 3GPP synch and control data and empty user data.  All slots and symbols subject to test are identical in each 17
frame, so tests do not have to wait for a specific frame number and are not expected to reset or otherwise perturb the 18
normal frame number sequence.  This is intended to allow the test to disrupt normal O -DU and O-RU operation as little 19
as possible. If there is a specific need to validate the construction of a specific frame or slot of data, a test may elect to 20
zero the test data and leave undefined the data sections for all except one slot or frame of data; where this is necessary it  21
will be described in the specific test definition, but this is expected to be an exceptional case. 22
 Generic Steps for Test Execution, O-RU TEST SCENARIO 23
The following are the generic test steps used when testing the O-RU, although specific tests may deviate from this 24
general procedure: 25
1) Configure the Test Equipment, O-RU (TER) for test execution, which may include defining the specific test to 26
execute. This may also include using a scripting language for describing the test. 27
2) Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation using 28
M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1. 29
3) Send appropriate C-Plane and U-Plane DL data flows and collect the O-RU radiated energy (or collect from 30
antenna connectors) using RF detection equipment. 31
4) Evaluate the RF energy pattern from the O-RU to determine if the O-RU correctly received and interpreted the 32
fronthaul C-Plane and U-Plane data flows.  In some cases, it also includes decoding and demodulating the RF 33
signal to ensure all UC-Plane messages were interpreted correctly. 34
5) Send appropriate C-Plane messages to define the desired UL U-Plane flow, at the same time cause the RF 35
signal generator to radiate (or feed into antenna connectors) the appropriate RF energy pattern  for the test.  36

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       68
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
This also means meeting the appropriate timing windows to allow the O-RU to decode and process the C-1
Plane messages before the signal generator starts sending RF. 2
6) Collect the O-RU UL data flows on the fronthaul interface and evaluate for correctness; this will generally be 3
U-Plane data only but in limited cases (LAA) may include UL C-Plane messages too. 4
7) Since FDD uplink and TDD tests require tight timing constraints between the components of the TER it is 5
recommended that CUSM emulator signal the RF test equipment when C -Plane signalling has started for a 6
frame.  How this signal is used by the RF test equipment to synchronize transmission and reception is 7
implementation dependant. 8
 9
 10
 UC-Plane Measurements, O-DU Test Scenario 11
For future study. 12
3.2.2 Minimum Capabilities of the TER for U-Plane and C-Plane Tests 13
Since many features of the O-RAN protocol rely on the O-DU instructing the O-RU to put data in specific resource 14
blocks using a specific compression method it is imperative that the test equipment support features that allow 15
comparing data on the fronthaul side with data on the RF side of the radio. 16
 Signal Analyzer 17
• Must have the capability of decoding and demodulating an RF signal either received over the air or on a 18
conducted interface.  This data must be made available for comparison with data sent on the fronthaul 19
interface. 20
• Must be able to determine the Phase and amplitude of any signal for beamforming tests. 21
• Obviously must support the frequency range of the radio being tested. 22
 Signal Generator 23
• Must provide software capable of building a correct 5G or LTE waveform. 24
• Should have the ability to automatically build 3GPP compliant test waveforms and should provide a  25
mechanism for editing the parameters of that waveform. 26
• Must be able to be synchronized with the O-DU emulator to ensure proper timing of uplink C-Plane and U-27
Plane messages 28
 CUSM-ECUSM-Plane Emulator (CUSM-E) 29
• Must be able to extract IQ data from uplink U-Plane messages and demodulate and decode the data to ensure it 30
is the same as what was commanded in the uplink C-Plane messages. 31
• Must have the ability to synchronize with the RF signal source. 32
• Should have the ability to perform as a PTP Master or subordinate depending on the synchronization 33
configuration the radio supports. 34
• Must have the ability to accept frequency domain IQ and encapsulate it according to user input on the correct 35
sections. 36
 37
3.2.3 FR1 FDD Conducted-Signal Tests  38
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class NR testing Generic (NRG)  39
Note that all downlink tests in this section use a 3GPP test wave form with 30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz 40
Bandwidth as described in section 3GPP 38.141 -1 NR-FR1-TM1.1 and section 3.2.1.1.5 of this document.  There are 41
several variations on this test signal depending on the capabilities of the radio.  If the radio does not support the 42
numerology used in the example tests as reported in the M-plane it will be up to the test developer to modify their tests 43
to adapt to the radio.  This can usually be accomplished by using stock test patters described above.  The test is 44

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       69
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
expected to follow the same spirit as the tests in this document but things like symbol numbers, number of PRBs, etc. 1
may have to be changed. 2
All uplink tests in this section use a 3GPP test waveform described in 38.141-1 section A1, in particular G-FR1-A5-1 3
(30 kHz subcarrier spacing, QPSK, 100 MHz BW). As with downlink tests if the radio does not support this signal it is 4
up to the test developer to modify the parameters of the test without changing the spirit of the test. 5
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Base 3GPP DL 6
A. Test Description and Applicability 7
This test is MANDATORY. 8
 9
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can meet the most basic downlink requirements for O -RAN fronthaul.  10
Subsequent tests will build on this to exercise additional capabilities of the Fronthaul.  11
 12
Using a standard 3GPP NR-FR1-TM1.1 test frame for FDD the O-DU emulator (i.e., O-RAN interface of the TER 13
described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that require the O-RU to transmit on the 14
downlink the standard NR-FR1-TM1.1 signal.  This signal is shown below in Figure 3.2.3.1-1. 15
 16
 17
Figure 3.2.3.1-1  NR-FR1-TM1.1 FDD Test Signal 18
This test frame consists of a PDCCH in the first two symbols of every slot consisting of 3 PRBs.  All the 19
remaining PRBs in the frame consist of Physical Downlink Shared Channel data. This configuration corresponds 20
to stock data section A (Section 3.2.1.1.5 above) in all symbols that do not contain PDCCH channels. If the radio 21
does not support the numerology described in section 3.2.3.1 the stock test frames can be adapted for smaller 22
numbers of PRBs and should still be used. 23
 24
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can transmit a basic 3GPP test frame using the default parameters in 25
section 3.2.1.1.5 of this document (or a similar 3GPP waveform) except only one spatial stream on one antenna 26
will be used.  This test is applicable for Category A and Category B radios (No precoding is required).  As per 27
TM-FR1-TM1.1 all user data in this test will be zeros. 28
 29
B. Test Entrance Criteria 30
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.1 of this document.  The test numerology will be 31
30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described by TM-FR1-TM1.1.  It will be for 5G New 32
Radio only. The radio must have conducted antenna ports (FR1) or TAB connectors. 33
 34

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       70
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
The O-RU must have a conducted antenna port (or TAB connector) to be connected to a signal analyzer.  It must 1
also support the default parameters defined in section 3.2.1.1.1 above. 2
 3
C. Test Methodology 4
1. Initial Conditions 5
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation 6
using M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the 7
O-RU antenna port and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and 8
demodulate the transmitted signal.   9
2. Procedure 10
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the NR-FR1-TM1.1 signal described above in the O-DU 11
emulator.  Use the O-DU emulator control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that describe 12
the signal. Every symbol should be described by a single section (DL -SCH and DCI) using section type 1 13
messages. No section type zero messages will be used for this test.  Encapsulate the IQ data i n U-Plane 14
messages. Play those messages to the O-RU respecting timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.1.  15
Repeat the entire frame the number of times required to synch the signal analyzer and allow it to 16
demodulate and decode the test frame. 17
 18
 19
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  20
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance 21
requirement for this radio category (i.e., EVM). 22
2. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should be the same as the signal described above.  If it 23
contains all the same PRB assignments and all zero data, the test passes. 24
 25
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended 3GPP DL – Resource allocation 26
A. Test Description and Applicability 27
This test is MANDATORY. 28
 29
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can accurately interpret C-Plane resource allocation messages, 30
transfer U-Plane data into the correct resource blocks and transmit this data accurately in the downlink.  This test is 31
applicable for Category A and Category B radios (No precoding is required).  The test will be conducted therefore 32
there will be no channel distortion or interference.  It is mandatory the radio pass this test to be considered O -RAN 33
conformant. 34
 35
Using a standard 3GPP NR-FR1-TM1.1 test frame for FDD the O-DU emulator (i.e., O-RAN interface of the TER 36
described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that require the O-RU to transmit on the 37
downlink the standard NR-FR1-TM1.1 signal.  This signal is shown below in Figure 3.2.3.1-2. 38
 39

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       71
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
 1
 2
Figure 3.2.3.1-2  NR-FR1-TM1.1 FDD Test Signal 3
 4
This test frame consists of a PDCCH in the first two symbols of every slot consisting of 3 PRBs.  All the remaining 5
PRBs in the frame consist of Physical Downlink Shared Channel data. This test requires non -zero data (PN23 6
Sequence)  to populate all allocated resource blocks.  This configuration corresponds to stock data section A in all 7
symbols that do not contain PDCCH channels. 8
 9
B. Test Entrance Criteria 10
The test numerology will be 30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described in section NR-FR1-11
TM1.1.  It will be for 5G New Radio only. The radio must have conducted antenna ports (FR1) or TAB connectors.  12
 13
 14
C. Test Methodology 15
 16
a. Initial Conditions 17
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation using 18
M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the O-RU 19
antenna port and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and 20
demodulate the transmitted signal.   21
b. Procedure 22
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the NR-FR1-TM1.1 signal described above in the O-DU emulator.  23
Use the O-DU emulator control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that describe the signal. 24
Every symbol should be described by a single section (DL-SCH and DCI) using section type 1 messages. The 25
data in the sections must be a PN23 sequence using an initial seed of all ones. No section type zero messages 26
will be used for this test.  Encapsulate the IQ data in U-Plane messages. Play those messages to the O-RU 27
respecting timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.1.  Repeat the entire frame the number of times 28
required to synch the signal analyzer and allow it to demodulate and decode the test frame. 29
 30
 31
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  32
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for 33
this radio category (i.e., EVM). 34

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       72
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
2. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should be the same as the signal described above.  If it contains 1
all the same PRB assignments and data, the test passes. 2
 3
 UC Plane O-RU Base Class FDD Test UL 4
A. Test Description and Applicability 5
This test is MANDATORY. 6
 7
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can meet the most basic uplink requirements for O -RAN fronthaul 8
correctly interpreting C-Plane messages and correctly constructing uplink U-Plane messages from an RF signal. 9
Subsequent tests will build on this to exercise additional capabilities of the Fronthaul.  10
 11
The test validates that correct uplink operation of the O-RU using 3GPP Reference Sensitivity level definition 12
(Section 7.2 TS 38.141-1) of the Conducted Receiver Characteristic Test section (Section 7 TS 38.141) and power 13
Levels at least 30 dB above Reference Sensitivity power Level described in TS 38.141-1 Table 7.2.5-1.  This is to 14
improve the likelihood that all data will be received by the radio correctly since we are not interested in testing 15
receiver sensitivity but only the O-RAN protocol compliance.  16
 17
 18
 19
Figure 3.2.3.1-3  G-FR1-A5-1 Uplink FDD Test Signal 20
 21
This signal is described by table A.1-1 in 3GPP 38.141-1 and is referred to as G-FR1-A1-5 with the power increased 22
to up to 30 dB above that described in Table 7.2.5-1.  Under those conditions, a 3GPP compliant O-RU should 23
deliver uplink U-Plane information that matches the uplink signal.  24
 25
The TER (Test Equipment, O-RU) generates an uplink signal on the antenna connector or TAB connector, together 26
with the corresponding C-Plane messages on the Fronthaul interface. 27
 28
The TER will capture the U-Plane messages generated by the DUT and validate whether the payload matches the 29
uplink signal.  30
 31
It applies to the following CUS fronthaul specification sections 32
• Section 5.4.2 for layout of C-Plane message, in particular Section Type 1 33
• Section 6.3.2 for U-Plane message layout 34
• Section 6.3.3 for coding of applicable Information Elements 35

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       73
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
 1
B. Test Entrance Criteria 2
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.1 of this document.  The test numerology will be 3
30 kHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described in section 3GPP TS 38.141-1 section G-FR1-A-5.  4
It will be for 5G New Radio only. The radio must have conducted antenna ports (FR1) or TAB connectors . Note 5
this signal may be changed to any of the 3GPP sensitivity test signals in table A.1 -1 in 3GPP TS 38.141-1 if the 6
radio does not support the numerology and bandwidth used in this test.  The test signal described in this section will 7
be used if the radio supports that numerology and bandwidth. 8
C. Test Methodology 9
Leverage from the well-known payload (PN23 sequence) of the uplink signal to compare it with the payload of the 10
signal communicated on the O-RAN interface. The IQ information is extracted from the U-Plane message and 11
demodulated to retrieve payload.  12
  13
a: Initial Conditions 14
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation using M-15
Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal source to the O-RU antenna 16
port and configure the source to transmit the required 3GPP test signal upon receiving a trigger signal from the 17
CUSM-E.  The signal source power level should be adjusted to at least 30 dB above the setting used in the 3GPP 18
receiver sensitivity test. 19
b: Procedure 20
• Load uplink test waveform (G-FR1-A1-5 : SCS30k_51RB) on the RF Signal Source  21
• Configure Signal Source to play test waveforms on 10ms frame boundaries starting when it receives a 22
trigger signal from the O-DU emulator that C-Plane messages have been sent. 23
• Load C-Plane message sequence on Test Equipment O-RU (TER)  24
• Arm Test Equipment O-RU (TER) to capture DUT fronthaul Messages  25
• Launch test to play the RF uplink frame after the C-Plane messages have been sent honoring timing 26
windows  27
• Record U-Plane messages from DUT for a complete frame and the eAxC corresponding to the Antenna port  28
• Extract IQ information  29
• Extract Payload 30
• Compare payload binary sequences  31
  32
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  33
1. The verdict is “Test pass” if the payload binary sequences match between the uplink test frame sent to the 34
DUT and the received U-Plane data from the DUT 35
2. If any of the test conditions are not true, the verdict for the whole test is "Fail" 36
 37
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended using RB Parameter 3GPP DL – Resource 38
Allocation 39
A. Test Description and Applicability 40
This test is MANDATORY. 41
 42
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can accurately interpret C-Plane resource allocation messages with 43
the rb parameter set, transfer U-Plane data into the correct resource blocks and transmit this data accurately in the 44
downlink.  This test is applicable for Category A and Category B radios (No precoding is required).  The test will 45
be conducted therefore there will be no channel distortion or interference.  It is mandatory the radio pass this test to 46
be considered O-RAN conformant. 47
 48
Using a standard 3GPP NR-FR1-TM1.1 test frame for FDD the O-DU emulator (i.e., O-RAN interface of the TER 49
described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that require the O-RU to transmit on the 50
downlink the standard NR-FR1-TM1.1 signal.  This signal is shown below in Figure 3.2.3.1-4. 51

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       74
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
 1
 2
Figure 3.2.3.1-4  NR-FR1-TM1.1 FDD Test Signal 3
 4
This test frame consists of a PDCCH in the first two symbols of every slot consisting of 3 PRBs.  All the 5
remaining PRBs in the frame consist of Physical Downlink Shared Channel data.  6
 7
This test requires non-zero data to populate all allocated resource blocks. 8
 9
B. Test Entrance Criteria 10
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.1 of this document.  The test numerology will be 11
30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described in section NR-FR1-TM1.1.  It will be for 5G 12
New Radio only. The radio must have conducted antenna ports (FR1) or TAB connectors.  The signal analyzer must 13
have the ability to decode the downlink shared channel. 14
 15
C. Test Methodology 16
a. Initial Conditions 17
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation using 18
M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the O-RU 19
antenna port and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and 20
demodulate the transmitted signal.   21
b. Procedure 22
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the NR-FR1-TM1.1 signal described above in the O-DU 23
emulator.  Use the O-DU emulator control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that 24
describe the signal.  Every allocated (see below) symbol should be described by sections (DL-SCH and 25
DCI) using section type 1 messages.  No section type zero messages will be used for this test.  Symbol #3 26
of each slot should be Stock data section type 6 “D”  as shown in section 3.2.1.1.5 above. The control 27
plane for symbol #3 will only include PRBs number 5 through 23. C-Plane messages will have the rb bit 28
set to one for this section. All other DL-SCH symbols and PRBs other than PRBs 5-23 will not contain 29
data.  There are two ways to conduct the test: 30
1. A single data section with the rb bit set and a PN23 sequence sent as shown below: 31

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       75
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
 1
A new PN23 sequence will be started but every other PRB will contain only the odd parts of the 2
PN23 sequence (as shown in green).  The other PRBs (shown in orange) will not contain data and 3
will not be sent to the O-RU.  Thus, a single data section will be used, and the corresponding U-4
Plane message will only contain data for the odd PRBs as shown above.  The parts of the PN23 5
sequence not used (shown marked with an X) will be discarded. 6
2. Two data sections one containing the odd parts of the PN23 sequence and the other containing the even 7
parts as shown below: 8
 9
A new PN23 sequence will be started but every other PRB in one section will contain only the odd 10
parts of the PN23 sequence (as shown in green).  The second data section will contain the even 11
parts of the PN23 sequence.  The C-Plane messages for both sections will use the rb bit. The U-12
Plane messages corresponding to the first data section will contain only the odd parts of the PN23 13
sequence, the U-Plane message corresponding to the second data section will only contain the even 14
parts.  Thus, a continuous PN23 sequence will be sent only in PRBs 5 through 23.  15
Additional sections should be included to describe the DCI symbols as well as Reference Signals 16
described in 38.141-1 Play those messages to the O-RU respecting timing windows described in 17
section 3.2.1.1.1.  Repeat the entire frame the number of times required to synch the signal analyzer 18
and allow it to demodulate and decode the test frame. 19
 20
 21
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  22

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       76
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for 1
this radio category (i.e., EVM). 2
2. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should only contain the PN23 sequence data in every other PRB 3
in symbol #3 PRBs 5 to 23 if the test is conducted using option #1. 4
3. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should only contain the PN23 sequence data in every PRB in 5
symbol #3 PRBs 5 to 23 if the test is conducted using option #2. 6
 7
 8
 UC Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended using RB Parameter 3GPP UL – Resource 9
Allocation 10
A. Test Description and Applicability 11
This test is MANDATORY. 12
 13
This test adds the capability of interpreting the rb parameter to the basic uplink test  14
 15
Validate correct uplink operation of the O-RU using 3GPP Reference Sensitivity level definition (Section 7.2 TS 16
38.141-1) of the Conducted Receiver Characteristic Test section (Section 7 TS 138.104) and power Levels at least 17
30 dB above Reference Sensitivity power Level described in TS 38.141-1 Table 7.2.5-1.  This is to improve the 18
likelihood that all data will be received by the radio correctly since we are not interested in testing receiver 19
sensitivity but only the O-RAN protocol compliance.  20
 21
 22
 23
 24
Figure 3.2.3.1-5 SCS15k_25RB Uplink FDD Test Signal 25
 26
Using an RF source, the test equipment will generate a 3GPP test signal as shown in Figure 3.2.3.1-5 above.  27
The radio will demodulate and decode this signal and send frequency domain IQ to the  O-DU-Emulator as 28
instructed by the O-DU-emulator using uplink C-Plane messages 29
 30
The TER (Test Equipment, O-RU) generates an uplink signal on the antenna connector or TAB connector, 31
together with the corresponding C-Plane messages on the Fronthaul interface. 32
 33
The TER will capture the U-Plane messages generated by the DUT and validate if the payload matches with 34
the uplink signal.  35

                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
 1
It applies to the following CUS fronthaul specification sections 2
• Section 5.4.2 for layout of C-Plane message, in particular Section Type 1 3
• Section 6.3.2 for U-Plane message layout 4
• Section 6.3.3 for coding of applicable Information Elements 5
 6
B. Test Entrance Criteria 7
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.1 of this document.  The test numerology will be 8
30 kHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described in section 3GPP TS 38.141-1 section G-FR1-A-1.  9
It will be for 5G New Radio only. The radio must have conducted antenna ports (FR1) or TAB connectors.  The 10
radio must report that it supports the rb parameter. Note this signal may be changed to any of the 3GPP sensitivity 11
test signals in table A.1-1 in 3GPP TS 38.141-1 if the radio does not support the numerology and bandwidth used 12
in this test.  The test signal described in this section will be used if the radio supports that numerology and 13
bandwidth. 14
 15
C. Test Methodology 16
Leverage from the well-known payload (Pseudo Random sequence) of the uplink signal to compare it with the 17
payload of the signal communicated on the O-RAN interface. The IQ information is extracted from the U-Plane 18
message and demodulated to retrieve payload.  19
  20
a: Initial Conditions 21
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation 22
using M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal source to the 23
O-RU antenna port and configure the source to transmit the required 3GPP test signal upon receiving a 24
trigger signal from the CUSM-E.  The signal source power level should be adjusted to at least 30 dB 25
above the setting used in the 3GPP receiver sensitivity test. 26
b: Procedure 27
• Load uplink test waveform (G-FR1-A1-5 : SCS30k_51RB) on the RF Signal Source.  28
Note this signal has a PN23 sequence as user data. 29
• Configure Signal Source to play test waveforms on 10ms frame boundaries starting when 30
it receives a trigger signal from the O-DU emulator that C-Plane messages have been 31
sent. 32
• Load C-Plane message sequence on Test Equipment O-RU (TER) – In this test only 33
symbol number 6 will be used and all 51 PRBs will be used.  All other symbols will not 34
contain data except required DRMS signals which may be used to synchronize test 35
equipment. There are two options for conducting this test: 36
A single data section with the rb bit set and a PN23 sequence sent as shown below:37
 38

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       78
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
A new PN23 sequence will be started but every other PRB will contain only the odd 1
parts of the PN23 sequence (as shown in orange).  The other PRBs (shown in white) 2
will not contain data and will not be sent to the O-RU.  Thus, a single data section 3
will be used, and the corresponding U-Plane message will only contain data for the 4
odd PRBs as shown above.  The parts of the PN23 sequence not used (shown marked 5
with an X) will be discarded. 6
2. Two data sections one containing the odd parts of the PN23 sequence and the other 7
containing the even parts as shown below: 8
 9
A new PN23 sequence will be started but every other PRB in one section will 10
contain only the odd parts of the PN23 sequence (as shown in green).  The 11
second data section will contain the even parts of the PN23 sequence.  The 12
C-Plane messages for both sections will use the rb bit. The U-Plane messages 13
corresponding to the first data section will contain only the odd parts of the 14
PN23 sequence, the U-Plane message corresponding to the second data 15
section will only contain the even parts.  Thus, a continuous PN23 sequence 16
will be sent only in PRBs 0 through 51. 17
• Arm Test Equipment O-RU (TER) to capture DUT fronthaul Messages  18
• Launch test to play the C-Plane messages and trigger the source to play the RF signal on 19
a frame boundary.  20
• Record U-Plane messages from DUT for a complete frame and the eAxC corresponding 21
to the Antenna port  22
• Extract IQ information  23
• Extract Payload 24
• Compare payload binary sequences 25
  26
  27
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  28
1. The   verdict is “Test pass” if payload binary sequences match between the uplink test frame sent to the DUT 29
and the received U-Plane data from the DUT.  In particular symbol #6 should contain either every other PRB  30
of the PN23 sequence or a continuous PN23 sequence in PRBs 0 through 51 depending which test option is 31
chosen. 32
2. If any of the test conditions is not true, the verdict for the whole test is "Fail". 33
 34

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       79
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended using SymInc Parameter 3GPP DL – 1
Resource Allocation 2
A. Test Description and Applicability 3
This test is CONDITIONAL MANDATORY. 4
 5
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can accurately interpret C-Plane resource allocation messages with 6
the SymInc parameter set, transfer U-Plane data into the correct resource blocks and transmit this data accurately in 7
the downlink.  This test is applicable for  Category A and  Category B radios (No precoding is required).  The test 8
will be conducted therefore there will be no channel distortion or interference.  9
 10
Using a standard 3GPP NR-FR1-TM1.1 test frame for FDD the O-DU emulator (i.e., O-RAN interface of the TER 11
described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that require the O-RU to transmit on the 12
downlink the standard NR-FR1-TM1.1 signal.  This signal is shown below in Figure 3.2.3.1-6. 13
 14
 15
 16
Figure 3.2.3.1-6 NR-FR1-TM1.1 FDD Test Signal 17
 18
This test frame consists of a PDCCH in the first two symbols of every slot consisting of 3 PRBs.  All the remaining 19
PRBs in the frame consist of Physical Downlink Shared Channel data. 20
 21
This test requires non-zero data to populate all allocated resource blocks.  This data will be a PN23 sequence with a 22
seed value of all ones. 23
 24
Two symbols will be reserved for testing the SymInc parameter as described below.  25
 26
B. Test Entrance Criteria 27
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.1 of this document.  The test numerology will be 28
30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described in section NR-FR1-TM1.1.  It will be for 5G 29
New Radio only. The radio must have conducted antenna ports (FR1) or TAB connectors.  30
 31
The Radio must support the SymInc parameter as notified by the M-Plane.  The signal analyzer must have the 32
ability to decode the downlink shared channel. 33
 34
C. Test Methodology 35
a. Initial Conditions 36
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation using 37
M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the O-RU 38

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       80
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
antenna port and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and 1
demodulate the transmitted signal.   2
b. Procedure 3
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the NR-FR1-TM1.1 signal described above in the O-DU emulator.  4
Use the O-DU emulator control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that describe the signal. 5
Every symbol should be described by a single type 1 section (DL-SCH and DCI) except symbols #5 and #6 6
which will be used for the SymInc test. The data in these sections must be a PN23 sequence using an initial 7
seed of all ones. Each symbol should be a new PN23 sequence, that is PRB 0 should contain the data from a 8
new PN23 sequence for each symbol. No section type zero messages will be used for this test.  9
 10
Symbols number 5 and 6 should be stock data sections type “E” as shown above.  This stock data section 11
consists of two adjacent symbols each containing two sections.  The corresponding C-Plane message will 12
contain 4 section IDs in a single C-Plane message describing symbols #5 and #6.  The startSymbolId in the 13
application header will be symbol #5. The second section ID for symbol #5 will have the SymInc bit set 14
informing the O-RU that the next section will begin describing symbol #6.  15
 16
The corresponding U-Plane messages will be a new PN23 Sequence for each symbol (5 and 6). 17
 18
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  19
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for 20
this radio category (i.e., EVM). 21
2. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should only contain the same PN23 signals that were sent in the 22
U-Plane. 23
 24
 UC Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended using SymInc Parameter 3GPP UL – 25
Resource Allocation 26
A. Test Description and Applicability 27
This test is CONDITIONAL MANDATORY. 28
 29
The purpose of this test is to add the capability of interpreting the SymInc parameter to the basic uplink test. 30
 31
Validate correct uplink operation of the O-RU using 3GPP Reference Sensitivity level definition (Section 7.2 TS 32
38.141-1) of the Conducted Receiver Characteristic Test section (Section 7 TS 38.141) and power Levels at least 33
30 dB above Reference Sensitivity power Level described in TS 38.141-1 table 7.2.5-1.  This is to improve the 34
likelihood that all data will be received by the radio correctly since we are not interested in testing receiver 35
sensitivity but only the O-RAN protocol compliance. C-Plane messages will contain 4 sections with the SymInc bit 36
set specifying that the radio should increment the current symbol. 37
 38

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       81
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
 1
 2
Figure 3.2.3.1-7 G-FR1-A5-1 Uplink FDD Test Signal 3
 4
Using an RF source, the test equipment will generate a 3GPP test signal as shown  in Figure 3.2.3.1-7  above.  The 5
radio will demodulate and decode this signal and send frequency domain IQ to the  O-DU-Emulator as instructed by 6
the O-DU-emulator using uplink C-Plane messages.  Note this signal has 20 slots with all symbols populated with 7
only uplink shared data in the only first 51 RBs.  The symbols are populated with PN23 data. 8
 9
The TER (Test Equipment, O-RU) generates an uplink signal on the antenna connector or TAB connector, together 10
with the corresponding C-Plane messages on the Fronthaul interface. 11
 12
The TER will capture the U-Plane messages generated by the DUT and validate if the payload matches with the 13
uplink signal.  14
 15
It applies to the following CUS fronthaul specification sections 16
• Section 5.4.2 for layout of C-Plane message, in particular Section Type 1 17
• Section 6.3.2 for U-Plane message layout 18
• Section 6.3.3 for coding of applicable Information Elements 19
 20
B. Test Entrance Criteria 21
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.1 of this document.  The test numerology will be 22
30 kHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described in section 3GPP TS 38.141-1 section G-FR1-A1-23
5.  It will be for 5G New Radio only. The radio must have conducted antenna ports (FR1) or TAB connectors. The 24
radio must report that it supports the SymInc parameter.   Note this signal may be changed to any of the 3GPP 25
sensitivity test signals in table A.1-1 in 3GPP TS 38.141-1 if the radio does not support the numerology and 26
bandwidth used in this test.  The test signal described in this section will be used if the radio supports that 27
numerology and bandwidth. 28
 29
C. Test Methodology 30
Leverage from the well-known payload (Pseudo Random sequence) of the uplink signal to compare it with the 31
payload of the signal communicated on the O-RAN interface. The IQ information is extracted from the U-Plane 32
message and demodulated to retrieve payload.  33
  34
a. Initial Conditions 35
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation using 36
M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal source to the O-RU 37

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       82
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
antenna port and configure the source to transmit the required 3GPP test signal upon receiving a trigger signal 1
from the CUSM-E.  The signal source power level should be adjusted to at least 30 dB above the setting used 2
in the 3GPP receiver sensitivity test. 3
b. Procedure 4
• Load uplink test waveform (G-FR1-A1-5 : SCS30k_51RB, 100 MHz) on the RF Signal Source.  Note this 5
signal has a PN23 sequence as user data.  Configure the source to generate a new PN23 sequence in 6
symbols #5 and #6. 7
• Configure Signal Source to play test waveforms on 10ms frame boundaries startin g when it receives a 8
trigger signal from the O-DU emulator that C-Plane messages have been sent. 9
• Load C-Plane message sequence on Test Equipment O-RU (TER) – Only symbols #5 and #6 in each slot 10
will be used in this test. All other symbols will contain either reference signals or data but will not be 11
considered part of the test.  These two symbols will be used to determine whether the radio properly 12
increments the current symbol ID when the SymInc bit is set. The C-Plane message for symbol #5 should 13
have the SymInc bit set.  This message should have a second section describing symbol #6 (using the 14
SymInc mechanism).  All PRBs in each symbol will be requested (In the example waveform 51 PRBs). 15
• Arm Test Equipment O-RU (TER) to capture DUT fronthaul Messages  16
• Launch test to play the C-Plane messages and trigger the source to play the RF signal on a frame 17
boundary.  18
• Record U-Plane messages from DUT for a complete frame and the eAxC corresponding to the Antenna 19
port  20
• Extract IQ information  21
• Extract Payload 22
• Compare payload binary sequences  23
  24
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  25
1. The verdict is “Test pass” if payload binary sequences match between the uplink test frame sent to the DUT 26
and the received U-Plane data from the DUT.  In particular symbols number 5 and 6 should properly contain 27
the correct PN23 sequences that were built by the signal source. 28
2. If any of the test conditions is not true, the verdict for the whole test is "Fail" 29
 30
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended using reMask Parameter 3GPP DL – 31
Resource Allocation 32
1. Test Description and Applicability 33
This test is MANDATORY. 34
 35
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can correctly decode and interpret C-Plane and U-Plane 36
messages putting resource block in the correct place in the transmitted signal using the reMask parameter. In 37
this test stock data section #6”D” will be used to exercise the reMask, only PRBs 1 through 5 w ill be used in 38
this test. 39
 40
Using a standard 3GPP NR-FR1-TM1.1 test frame for FDD the O-DU emulator (i.e., O-RAN interface of 41
the TER described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that require the O-RU to 42
transmit on the downlink the standard NR-FR1-TM1.1 signal as modified below.  This signal is shown 43
below in Figure 3.2.3.1-8: 44
 45

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       83
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
 1
 2
Figure 3.2.3.1-8 NR-FR1-TM1.1 Modification 1 3
 4
This generic 3GPP NR-FR1-TM1.1 test frame consists of a PDCCH in the first two symbols of every slot 5
consisting of 3 PRBs.  All the remaining PRBs in the frame consist of Physical Downlink Shared  Channel 6
data. 7
 8
This test requires non-zero data to populate all allocated resource blocks (as described below).  This data 9
will be a PN23 sequence with a seed value of all ones. 10
 11
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can accurately interpret C-Plane resource allocation messages 12
with the reMask parameter set, transfer U-Plane data into the correct resource elements and transmit this 13
data accurately in the downlink.  This test is applicable for  Category A and  Category B radios (No 14
precoding is required).  The test will be conducted therefore there will be no channel distortion or 15
interference.  It is mandatory the radio pass this test to be considered O -RAN conformant. 16
 17
This test will utilize stock data section #6 described above. 18
 19
2. Test Entrance Criteria 20
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.1 of this document.  The test numerology 21
will be 30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described in section NR-FR1-TM1.1.  It will 22
be for 5G New Radio only. The radio must have conducted antenna ports (FR1) or TAB connectors.  23
 24
The Radio must support the reMask parameter as notified by the M-Plane.  The signal analyzer must have 25
the ability to decode the downlink shared channel. 26
 27
3. Test Methodology 28
 29
a. Initial Conditions 30
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation using M-Plane 31
commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the O-RU antenna port and 32
configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and demodulate the transmitted signal.   33
b. Procedure 34
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the NR-FR1-TM1.1 signal described above in the O-DU 35
emulator.  Use the O-DU emulator control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that 36
describe the signal as described below. Every symbol allocated should be described by type 1 sections 37
(DL-SCH and DCI).   Only symbol #2 will be used for the reMask test. The data in this section must be 38
a PN23 sequence using an initial seed of all ones. The first bits of the PN23 will be in PRB1 and 39

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       84
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
continue in consecutive resource elements to the end of PRB5. No section type zero messages will be 1
used for this test.  The PN23 sequence will be interleaved with DMRS signals as shown below:  2
 3
 4
 5
Symbol number 2 should be stock data section type “D” as shown above.  This test will only be using 6
PRBs 1 through 5.  The corresponding C-Plane message will contain two section IDs in a single C-7
Plane message describing symbol #2.  The startSymbolId in the application header will be symbol #2. 8
The C-Plane message will have one section with the reMask set to only the odd number resource 9
elements and another section with the reMask set to the even elements.  The number of PRBs will be 4. 10
The start PRB will be 1. 11
 12
The corresponding U-Plane messages will be a new PN23 Sequence (initial seed is all ones) in PRBs 1 13
through 5 of symbol #2 and another U-Plane message containing DMRS signals. 14
 15
4. Test Requirement (expected result)  16
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for 17
this radio category (i.e., EVM). 18
2. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should only contain the same PN23 signals that were sent in 19
the U-Plane but only in every other odd resource element. The even resource elements should contain 20
DMRS signals. 21
 22

  UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended using Non-contiguous PRB Allocation 1
Section Extension 3GPP DL – Resource Allocation 2
A. Test Description and Applicability 3
This test is CONDITIONAL MANDATORY. 4
 5
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can correctly decode and interpret C-Plane and U-Plane messages 6
putting resource block in the correct place in the transmitted signal using the extension type 6. In this test stock data 7
section definition C will be used to exercise the non-contiguous RB allocation, all 273 PRBs (or the max number of 8
PRBs per symbol for the highest numerology the radio supports) will be used in this test. 9
 10
Using a standard 3GPP NR-FR1-TM1.1 test frame for FDD the O-DU emulator (i.e., O-RAN interface of the TER 11
described in section2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that require the O-RU to transmit on the 12
downlink the standard NR-FR1-TM1.1 signal with the modifications described below (supporting non-contiguous 13
PRB allocation)..  The standard 3GPP NR-FR1-TM1.1 is shown in Figure 3.2.3.1-10 below: 14
 15
 16
Figure 3.2.3.1-10 3GPP NR-FR1-TM1.1 Test Signal 17
This generic NR-FR1-TM1.1 test frame consists of a PDCCH in the first two symbols of every slot consisting of 18
3 PRBs.  All the remaining PRBs in the frame consist of Physical Downlink Shared Channel data. 19
 20
This test requires non-zero data to populate all allocated resource blocks.  This data will be a PN23 sequence 21
with a seed value of all ones as described below. 22
 23
This test will utilize stock data section definition C described above.  This data section includes 4 RBs in the first 24
RB group, the second group of 4 RBs are blank and the remainder of the RBGs contain user data.  This stock 25
data section will be repeated over three symbols to test the SymbolMask parameter. 26
 27
B. Test Entrance Criteria 28
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.1  of this document.  The test numerology will 29
be 30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described in section NR-FR1-TM1.1.  It will be for 30
5G New Radio only. The radio must have conducted antenna ports (FR1) or TAB connectors.   The Radio must 31
support the extension type 6 as notified by the M-Plane.  The signal analyzer must have the ability to decode the 32
downlink shared channel. 33
 34
C. Test Methodology 35
a. Initial Conditions 36
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation using 37
M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the O-RU 38

Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       88
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
antenna port and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and 1
demodulate the transmitted signal.   2
b. Procedure 3
For this test only symbols number 6 and 7 will be used in each slot.  Other symbols may contain data 4

resource block group size will be 16 based on 3GPP 38.214 Table 5.1.2.2.1-1 as shown in Table 3.2.3.1-1 7
below using configuration 2.   8

Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the NR-FR1-TM1.1 signal described above in the O-DU emulator.  21
Use the O-DU emulator control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that describe the signal. 22
Every symbol should be described by a single type 1 section (DL-SCH and DCI) except symbols 23
#6 and #7 which will be used for the section extension 6 test. The d ata in symbol #6 should be a new PN23 24
sequence starting in the first PRB and continuing to PRB 273 (RBG number 17).  Symbol #7 should be identical 25
to symbol #6.  The rbgMask value should be set to 1011111111111111111111111111b and the symbolMask 26
value should be set to 000000110000000b.  No section type zero messages will be used for this test.  27

this message will have the section ID used in the C-Plane message described above.  Another U-Plane message 30

D. Test Requirement (expected result)  4
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for this 5
radio category (i.e., EVM). 6
2. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should only contain the same PN23 signals that were sent in the 7
U-Plane, that is the PN23 sequence in the first 16 PRBs, nothing in the next 4 PRBs and the remainder of the 8
PN23 sequence in RGBs 2-17. 9
 10
  UC Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended using Non-contiguous PRB Allocation 11
Section Extension 3GPP UL – Resource Allocation 12
A. Test Description and Applicability 13
This test is CONDITIONAL MANDATORY. 14
 15
The purpose of this test is to validate the capability of interpreting the section extension 6, non-contiguous PRB 16
allocation to the basic uplink test. 17
 18
Validate correct uplink operation of the O-RU using 3GPP Reference Sensitivity level definition (Section 7.2 TS 19
38.141-1) of the Conducted Receiver Characteristic Test section (Section 7 TS 38.141) and power Levels at least 20
30 dB above Reference Sensitivity power Level described in TS 38.141-1 table 7.2.5-1.  This is to improve the 21
likelihood that all data will be received by the radio correctly since we are not interested in testing receiver 22
sensitivity but only the O-RAN protocol compliance. C-Plane messages will contain 2 symbols with the same set of 23
non-contiguous PRBs referenced to test both the symbolMask and the rgbMask. 24
 25
 26
 27
 28
Figure 3.2.3.1-11 G-FR1-A5-1 UL FDD Test Signal 29
 30
Using an RF source, the test equipment will generate a 3GPP test signal as shown  in Figure 3.2.3.1-11 above.  31
The radio will demodulate and decode this signal and send frequency domain IQ to the  O-DU-Emulator as 32
instructed by the O-DU-emulator using uplink C-Plane messages containing section extension 6.  Note this 33
signal has 20 slots with all symbols populated with only uplink shared data in the only first 5 1 RBs.  The 34
symbols are populated with PN23 data. 35
 36

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       90
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
The TER (Test Equipment, O-RU) generates an uplink signal on the antenna connector or TAB connector, 1
together with the corresponding C-Plane messages on the Fronthaul interface. 2
 3
The TER will capture the U-Plane messages generated by the DUT and validate if the payload matches with the 4
uplink signal.  5
 6
It applies to the following CUS fronthaul specification sections 7
• Section 5.4.2 for layout of C-Plane message, in particular Section Type 1 8
• Section 6.3.2 for U-Plane message layout 9
• Section 6.3.3 for coding of applicable Information Elements 10
 11
B. Test Entrance Criteria 12
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.1 of this document.  The test numerology will be 13
30 kHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described in section 3GPP TS 38.141-1 section G-FR1-A1-5.  14
It will be for 5G New Radio only. The radio must have conducted antenna ports (FR1) or TAB connectors.  The 15
radio must report that it supports section extension type 6, non-contiguous PRB allocations.  The radio must report 16
that it supports section extension type 6, non-contiguous PRB allocations. Note this signal may be changed to any of 17
the 3GPP sensitivity test signals in table A.1-1 in 3GPP TS 38.141-1 if the radio does not support the numerology 18
and bandwidth used in this test.  The test signal described in this section will be used if the radio supports that 19
numerology and bandwidth. 20
 21
C. Test Methodology 22
Leverage from the well-known payload (Pseudo Random sequence) of the uplink signal to compare it with the 23
payload of the signal communicated on the O-RAN interface. The IQ information is extracted from the U-Plane 24
message and demodulated to retrieve payload.  25
  26
a. Initial Conditions 27
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation using M-28
Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal source to the O-RU antenna 29
port and configure the source to transmit the required 3GPP test signal upon receiving a trigger signal from the 30
CUSM-E.  The signal source power level should be adjusted to at least 30 dB above the setting used in the 3GPP 31
receiver sensitivity test. 32
 33
b. Procedure 34
• Load uplink test waveform (G-FR1-A1-5 : SCS130k_51RB) on the RF Signal Source.  Note this signal 35
should contain a new PN23 sequence as user data in PRBs 0 through 51 for symbols 6 and 7.  The remainder 36
of the test waveform is as described in 3GPP. 37
• Configure Signal Source to play test waveforms on 10ms frame boundaries starting when it receives a trigger 38
signal from the O-DU emulator that C-Plane messages have been sent. 39
• Load C-Plane message sequence on Test Equipment O-RU (TER) – Use the O-DU emulator control 40
interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that describe the signal. For this test symbols number 6 41
and 7 will be used in each slot.  The starting PRB will be zero and number of PRBs will be 2 73.  The 42
resource block group size will be 16.  Using the calculations in the O-RAN fronthaul specification section 43
5.4.7.6 the ID of the last RBG will be 17, f(0) will be 16, f(n) will be 16 and f(lastRbgID) will be 1.  44
StartPrbc will be zero and numPrbc will be 273. 45
Every symbol should be described by a single type 1 section (DL-SCH and DCI) except symbols #6 and #7 46
which will be used for the section extension 6 test. The data in symbol #6 is expected to be a new PN23 47
sequence starting in the first PRB and continuing to PRB 48 (RGB number 2).  Symbol #7 should be 48
identical to symbol #6.  The rbgMask value should be set to 1010000000000000000000000000b  and the 49
symbolMask value should be set to 000000110000000b.  No section type zero messages will be used for this 50
test. 51
• Arm Test Equipment O-RU (TER) to capture DUT fronthaul Messages  52
• Launch test to play the C-Plane messages and trigger the source to play the RF signal on a frame boundary.  53
• Record U-Plane messages from DUT for a complete frame and the eAxC corresponding to the Antenna port  54
• Extract IQ information  55
• Extract Payload 56
• Compare payload binary sequences  57
  58
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  59

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       91
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
1. The verdict is “Test pass” if the test frame received by the signal analyzer contains the same PN23 signals that 1
were sent in the U-Plane, that is the PN23 sequence in the first 16 PRBs, nothing in the next 16 PRBs and the 2
remainder of the PN23 sequence in RGBs 2 (Next 16 PRBs). 3
2. If any of the test conditions is not true, the verdict for the whole test is "Fail" 4
 5
 6
 7
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Section Extension 10 – Multiple Port Grouping DL – 8
Resource allocation 9
A. Test Description and Applicability 10
This test is CONDITIONAL MANDATORY. 11
 12
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can accurately interpret C-Plane resource allocation messages when 13
section extension 10 is supported by the radio, transfer U-Plane data into the correct resource blocks and transmit 14
this data accurately in the downlink.  This test is applicable for Category A and Category B radios (No precoding is 15
required).  The test will be conducted therefore there will be no channel distortion or interference.  Note the 16
purpose of this test is not to test the use of section extension 10 with either section extension 1 or 2 (Real time 17
beam weights or attributes) since these are special conditions.  There are three versions of beam groupings: 18
Common Beam, beam matrix indication or beam vector listing.  Each of these will be tested.  The beamforming 19
measurements will be conducted using the method described in section 3.2.3.2.3 and 3.2.3.2.4 (Predefined 20
beamforming). 21
 22
Using a standard 3GPP NR-FR1-TM1.1 test frame for FDD the O-DU emulator (i.e., O-RAN interface of the TER 23
described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that require the O-RU to transmit on the 24
downlink the standard NR-FR1-TM1.1 signal.  This signal is shown below in Figure 3.2.3.1-2. 25
 26
 27
 28
Figure 3.2.3.1-12 NR-FR1-TM1.1 FDD Test Signal 29
This test frame consists of a PDCCH in the first two symbols of every slot consisting of 3 PRBs.  All the remaining 30
PRBs in the frame consist of Physical Downlink Shared Channel data. This test requires non -zero data (PN23 31
Sequence)  to populate all allocated resource blocks.  This configuration corresponds to stock data section A in all 32
symbols that do not contain PDCCH channels. 33

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       92
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
 1
For this test the O-RU will indicate the default eAxC ID to use indicating this port grouping as well as the number 2
of ports in this grouping, call this value nPG. 3
 4
B. Test Entrance Criteria 5
The test numerology will be 30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described in section NR-FR1-6
TM1.1.  It will be for 5G New Radio only.  7
 8
There will be numPortc “layers” or eAxCs referred to in the test.  That is there will be one C-Plane message 9
referencing the port group eAxC ID obtained from the M-Plane but numPortc U-Plane messages. 10
 11
Manufacturers’ must provide their defined list of beam indices and their associated magnitude and phase relation 12
between antenna ports or TAB connectors and/or beam directions with antenna array characteristics.  13
 14
 15
C. Test Methodology 16
 17
a. Initial Conditions 18
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation using M-19
Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the O-RU 20
antenna ports being tested and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch 21
and demodulate the transmitted signal.  Ensure that the RF connections and cables are calibrated so there is 22
phase coherence between the antenna ports (or TAB connectors) within acceptable tolerance.  Let the DUT and 23
TER to warm to the normal operating temperature within specified range. 24
b. Procedure 25
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the NR-FR1-TM1.1 signal described above in the O-DU emulator.  26
Use the O-DU emulator control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane message that describes the signal.  27
This message should include section extension 10. Note the test will be performed three times exercising all 28
three beam group types. Every symbol should be described by a single section (DL-SCH and DCI) using 29
section type 1 messages. The data in the sections must be a PN23 sequence using an initial seed of all ones. No 30
section type zero messages will be used for this test.  Encapsulate the IQ data in U-Plane messages for each 31
layer (i.e., numPortc repetitions).  32
 33
Test case #1 (beamGroupType = 00b, Common Beam): 34
For this test the beamGroupType parameter should be set to 00b. It is expected that all layers will be played on 35
the same beam ID and this is the beam ID used in the corresponding C-Plane message. Play those messages to 36
the O-RU respecting timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.1.  Repeat the entire frame the number of 37
times required to synch the signal analyzer and allow it to demodulate and decode the test frame.  Use the 38
signal analyzer to decode at least two beams and ensure they are the same. 39
 40
Test case #2 (beamGroupType = 01b, beam matrix indication): 41
For this test the beamGroupType parameter should be set to 01b. It is expected that all layers will be played on 42
consecutive beam IDs starting with the beam ID in the C-Plane message. Play those messages to the O-RU 43
respecting timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.1.  Repeat the entire frame the number of times 44
required to synch the signal analyzer and allow it to demodulate and decode the test frame.  Use the signal 45
analyzer to decode at least two beams and ensure they meet the consecutive beam criteria. 46
 47
Test case #3 (beamGroupType = 10b, beam vector listing): 48
For this test the beamGroupType parameter should be set to 10b. In this case the section extension should list 49
“numPortc” beam IDs in section extension 10.  It is expected that all layers will be played on the beam IDs 50
indicated in the section extension. Play those messages to the O-RU respecting timing windows described in 51
section 3.2.1.1.1.  Repeat the entire frame the number of times required to synch the signal analyzer and allow 52
it to demodulate and decode the test frame.  Use the signal analyzer to decode at least two beams and ensure 53
they agree with the beam vector listing. 54
 55
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  56
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for this 57
radio category (i.e., EVM). 58
2. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should be the same as the signal described above.   59
3. If it contains all the same PRB assignments and data, and the beams are measured as described in test cases #1 60
through #3 above the test passes. 61

 UC Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended multiple port grouping using section 2
extension 10 UL– Resource Allocation 3
A. Test Description and Applicability 4
This test is CONDITIONAL MANDATORY. 5
 6
The purpose of this test is to validate the capability of interpreting the section extension 10, multiple port groupings 7
in the basic uplink test. 8
 9
Validate correct uplink operation of the O-RU using 3GPP Reference Sensitivity level definition (Section 7.2 TS 10
38.141-1) of the Conducted Receiver Characteristic Test section (Section 7 TS 38.141) and power Levels at least 11
30 dB above Reference Sensitivity power Level described in TS 38.141-1 table 7.2.5-1.  This is to improve the 12
likelihood that all data will be received by the radio correctly since we are not interested in testing receiver 13
sensitivity but only the O-RAN protocol compliance. Note the purpose of this test is not to test the use of section 14
extension 10 with either section extension 1 or 2 (Real time beam weights or attributes) since these are special 15
conditions.  There are three versions of beam groupings: Common Beam, beam matrix indication or beam vector 16
listing.  Each of these will be tested.  The beamforming measurements will be cond ucted using the method 17
described in section 3.2.3.2.3 and 3.2.3.2.4 (Predefined beamforming). 18
 19
Only section type 1 messages will be used in this test. 20

It applies to the following CUS fronthaul specification sections 1
• Section 5.4.2 for layout of C-Plane message, in particular Section Type 1 2
• Section 6.3.2 for U-Plane message layout 3
• Section 6.3.3 for coding of applicable Information Elements 4
 5
B. Test Entrance Criteria 6
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.1 of this document.  The test numerology will be 7
30 kHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described in section 3GPP TS 38.141-1 section G-FR1-A1-8
5.  It will be for 5G New Radio only. The radio must have conducted antenna ports (FR1) or TAB connectors.  The 9
radio must report that it supports section extension type 10, multiple port groupings.  Note this signal may be 10
changed to any of the 3GPP sensitivity test signals in table A.1-1 in 3GPP TS 38.141-1 if the radio does not 11
support the numerology and bandwidth used in this test.  The test signal described in this section will be used if the 12
radio supports that numerology and bandwidth. Manufacturers’ must provide their defined list of beam indices and 13
their associated magnitude and phase relation between antenna ports or TAB connectors and/or beam  directions 14
with antenna array characteristics. 15
 16
 17
C. Test Methodology 18
Leverage from the well-known payload (Pseudo Random sequence) of the uplink signal to compare it with the 19
payload of the signal communicated on the O-RAN interface. The IQ information is extracted from the U-Plane 20
message and demodulated to retrieve payload. Signals will be applied to connector ports emulating the phase and 21
amplitude corresponding to the associated beam ID direction or phase relationship provided by the manufacturer.  22
  23
c. Initial Conditions 24
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation using M-25
Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal source to the O-RU antenna 26
ports that belong to the beam under test and configure the source to transmit the required 3GPP test signal upon 27
receiving a trigger signal from the CUSM-E.  Ensure that the RF connections and cables are calibrated so there is 28
phase coherence between the antenna ports (or TAB connectors) within acceptable tolerance.  The signal source 29
power level should be adjusted to at least 30 dB above the setting used in the 3GPP receiver sensitivity test. Let 30
the DUT and TER to warm to the normal operating temperature within specified range  31
 32
d. Procedure 33
• Load uplink test waveform (G-FR1-A1-5 : SCS130k_51RB) on the RF Signal Source.  Note this signal 34
should contain a new PN23 sequence as user data in PRBs 0 through 51 for symbols 6 and 7.  The remainder 35
of the test waveform is as described in 3GPP. 36
• Configure Signal Source to play test waveforms on 10ms frame boundaries starting when it receives a trigger 37
signal from the O-DU emulator that C-Plane messages have been sent. 38
• Inject the test signal into the O-RU with the application of an initial set of beamweights, or equivalently 39
magnitude and phase relation, between all the TER ports connected to the antenna ports (or TAB connectors) 40
to emulate the phase and magnitude difference “seen” by the antenna elements under test. For example, 41
initial beamweights could be set to be “all equal” (i.e. no beamforming).   42
• Load C-Plane message sequence on Test Equipment O-RU (TER) – Use the O-DU emulator control 43
interface to build the appropriate C-Plane message (Single C-Plane message) that describes the signal. For 44
this test symbols number 6 and 7 will be used in each slot.   45
Every symbol should be described by a single type 1 section (DL-SCH and DCI) except symbols #6 and #7 46
which will be used as the payload data. The data in symbol #6 is expected to be a new PN23 sequence 47
starting in the first PRB and continuing to PRB 51.  Symbol #7 should be identical to symbol #6. No section 48
type zero messages will be used for this test.  The C-Plane message should include section extension 10 with 49
numPortc equal to what was received on the M-Plane at startup.  The eAxC ID should be the group eAxC ID 50
also received from the M-Plane.  Run the test three times using: 51
Test Case #1 (beamGroupType = 00b, Common Beam): All layers should have the same beam ID.  The 52
signal sent by the source should correspond to the same beam ID.  It is expecte d that the source is connected 53
to at least two port groups to ensure the same beam is being used. 54
Test Case #2 (beamGroupType = 01b, beam matrix indication): All layers should have consecutive beam IDs 55
starting with the beam ID in the C-Plane message.  The signal sent by the source should correspond to the 56
consecutive beam IDs.  It is expected that the source is connected to at least two port groups to ensure the 57
consecutive beams are being used 58

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       95
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
Test Case #3 (beamGroupType = 10b, beam vector listing): All layers will be assigned beam IDs based on the list 1
of beam IDs contained in the section extension.  The number of beam IDs must be equal to numPortc.  The signal 2
sent by the source should correspond to the signalled beam IDs.  It is expected that the source is connected to at 3
least two port groups to ensure that the correct beams are being used 4
• Arm Test Equipment O-RU (TER) to capture DUT fronthaul Messages  5
• Launch test to play the C-Plane message and trigger the source to play the RF signal on a frame boundary. 6
Respect all timing windows. 7
• Signal the signal source that C-Plane messages have been sent to allow it to start sending RF.  Respect all 8
timing windows. 9
• Record U-Plane messages from DUT for a complete frame and the eAxC corresponding to the Antenna port  10
• Extract IQ information  11
• Extract Payload 12
• Compare payload binary sequences  13
  14
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  15
1. The test frame received by the signal analyzer must contain the same PN23 signals that were sent in the U-16
Plane. 17
The beamweights or magnitude and phase relation at the antenna ports (or TAB connectors) of the test signal 18
that achieves the best performance (i.e., highest EVM, power, SNR, etc.) should match the manufacturer’s 19
declaration of the beam under test.  If this is also true, the test passes. 20

 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended 3GPP DL – Resource allocation – Coupling 22
C and U plane via Frequency and Time 23
A. Test Description and Applicability 24
This test is CONDITIONAL  MANDATORY. 25
 26
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can accurately interpret C-Plane resource allocation messages, 27
transfer U-Plane data into the correct resource blocks and transmit this data accurately in the downlink  when the 28
radio reports it supports the option feature of coupling C and U plane messages via frequency and time .  This test is 29
applicable for Category A and Category B radios (No precoding is required).  The test will be conducted therefore 30
there will be no channel distortion or interference.  It is mandatory the radio pass this test if it reports it supports 31
coupling C and U plane via time and frequency. 32
 33
Using a standard 3GPP NR-FR1-TM1.1 test frame for FDD the O-DU emulator (i.e., O-RAN interface of the TER 34
described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that require the O-RU to transmit on the 35
downlink the standard NR-FR1-TM1.1 signal.  This signal is shown below in Figure 3.2.3.1-2. 36
 37
 38
