                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can transmit a basic 3GPP test frame using the default parameters in 1
section 3.2.1.1.1 of this document except for only one spatial stream on one antenna will be used.   2
 3
This test is applicable for Category A and Category B radios (No precoding is required).   4
As per E-TM1.1 all user data in this test will be zeros.  The test will be conducted.   5
 6
B. Test Entrance Criteria 7
• The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.1 of this document.  The test bandwidth is 20 8
MHz Bandwidth as described by E-TM1.1. 9
• The signal analyzer must have the ability to decode the downlink shared channel.  10
 11
C. Procedure 12
a. Initial Conditions 13
• Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation using 14
M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1. 23  15
• Ensure that the test antenna/s and TER equipment is calibrated within acceptable tolerance.  16
• Place the test antenna/s to a defined position within the OTA chamber as defined in 3.2.1.1.2 and configure 17
the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and demodulate the transmitted 18
signal. 19
• Place the O-RU into a test calibrated point within the OTA chamber as defined in 3.2.1.1.2. 20
• Align the O-RU to a default initial position, i.e. align the O-RU to the origin of coordinates of the declared 21
coordinate reference point and orientation in the OTA chamber as defined in 3.2.1.1.2.  22
• Let the DUT and TER to warm to the normal operating temperature within specified range.  23
 24
b. Procedure 25
• Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the E-TM1.1 signal described above in the CUSM-E.  26
• Use the CUSM-E control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that describe the signal. 27
Every symbol should be described by a single section (DL-SCH and DCI) using section type 1 messages.  28
• The data in the sections must be all zeros sequence .  29
• No section type zero messages will be used for this test.  30
• Encapsulate the IQ data in U-Plane messages. Play those messages to the O-RU respecting timing 31
windows described in section 3.2.1.1.1.  Repeat the entire frame the number of times required to synch the 32
signal analyzer and allow it to demodulate and decode the test frame. 33
 34
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  35
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for 36
this radio category (i.e., EVM). 37
2. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should be the same as the signal described above.  If it contains 38
all the same PRB assignments and all zero data, the test passes. 39
 40
 41
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended 3GPP DL – Resource Allocation 42
The test description, execution and pass criteria is the same as described in  section 3.2.3.7.2. The only difference is that 43
the test setup is as described in 3.2.1.1.2 with a single signal analyzer setup as described above in Figure 3.2.4.7-1. 44
A. Test Description and Applicability 45
This test is MANDATORY. 46
 47
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can accurately interpret C-Plane resource allocation messages, 48
transfer U-Plane data into the correct resource blocks and transmit this data accurately in the downlink.   49
 50
This test requires non-zero data to populate all allocated resource blocks.  This data will be a PN23 sequence with a 51
seed value of all ones. 52
 53
This test is applicable for both Category A and Category B radios.  54
 55
B. Test Entrance Criteria 56

• The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1 of this document.  The test bandwidth is 20 1
MHz Bandwidth as described by E-TM1.1. 2
• The signal analyzer must have the ability to decode the downlink shared channel. 3
 4
C. Test Methodology 5
 6
a. Initial Conditions 7
• Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation using 8

signal. 14

coordinate reference point and orientation in the OTA chamber as defined in 3.2.1.1.2.  17

• Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the E-TM1.1 signal described above in the CUSM-E.  20

 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended 3GPP UL – Resource Allocation 35
The test description, execution and pass criteria is the same as described in section 3.2.3.7.3.  The only difference is that 36
the test setup is as described in section 3.2.1.1.2 Non-conducted OTA FDD tests for FR1 radios with a single signal 37

A. Test Description and Applicability 39
This test is MANDATORY. 40
 41
The purpose of this test is to validate correct uplink operation of the O-RU using 3GPP Reference Sensitivity level 42
definition (Section 7.2 TS 36.141) of the Conducted Receiver Characteristic Test section (Section 7 TS 36.104) and 43
power levels at least 30 dB above Reference Sensitivity power Level described in E-TM1.1.  This is to improve the 44
likelihood that all data will be received by the radio correctly since we are not interested in testing receiver 45
sensitivity but only the O-RAN protocol compliance.  46
 47
Under those conditions, 3GPP compliant O-RU should deliver uplink U-Plane information that matches with the 48
uplink signal.  49
 50
The TER (Test Equipment, O-RU) generates an uplink signal on the signal generator which is then transmitted over 51
the air via the test antenna, together with the corresponding C-Plane messages on the Fronthaul interface. The TER 52
will capture the U-Plane messages generated by the DUT and validate if the payload matches with the uplink 53
signal.  54
 55
This test is applicable for both  Category A and  Category B radios. 56

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       181
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
 1
It applies to the following CUS fronthaul specification sections 2
• Section 5.4.2 for layout of C-Plane message, in particular Section Type 1 3
• Section 6.3.2 for U-Plane message layout 4
• Section 6.3.3 for coding of applicable Information Elements 5
 6
B. Test Entrance Criteria 7
 8
• The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1 of this document.  The test bandwidth is 20 9
MHz Bandwidth as described by E-TM1.1. 10
• The signal analyzer must have the ability to decode the downlink shared channel.  11
 12
C. Test Methodology 13
 14
a. Initial Conditions 15
• Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation 16
using M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.   17
• Configure the source to transmit the required 3GPP test signal upon receiving a trigger signal from the 18
CUSM-ECUSM-E.  The signal source power level should be adjusted to setting used in the 3GPP receiver 19
sensitivity test. 20
• Ensure that the test antenna/s and TER equipment is calibrated within acceptable tolerance.  21
• Place the test antenna/s to a defined position within the OTA chamber as defined in 3.2.1.1.2 and 22
configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and demodulate the 23
transmitted signal. 24
• Place the O-RU into a test calibrated point within the OTA chamber as defined in 3.2.1.1.2. 25
• Align the O-RU to a default initial position, i.e. align the O-RU to the origin of coordinates of the declared 26
coordinate reference point and orientation in the OTA chamber as defined in 3.2.1.1.2.  27
• Let the DUT and TER to warm to the normal operating temperature within specified range.  28
 29
b.  Procedure 30
• Load uplink test waveform (A1-1) on the RF Signal Source. Number of allocated RB is 6 as in A1-1 and 31
the data content is a PN23 sequence. 32
• Configure Signal Source to play test waveforms on 10ms frame boundaries starting when it receives a 33
trigger signal from the CUSM-E that C-Plane messages have been sent. 34
• Load C-Plane message sequence on Test Equipment O-RU (TER)  35
• Arm Test Equipment O-RU (TER) to capture DUT fronthaul messages  36
• Launch test to simultaneously play RF uplink frame and C-Plane messages  37
• Record U-Plane messages from DUT for a complete frame and the eAxC corresponding to the Antenna 38
port  39
• Extract IQ information  40
• Extract Payload 41
• Compare payload binary sequences  42
 43
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  44
a. The verdict is “Test pass” if payload binary sequences match between the uplink test frame sent to the 45
DUT and the received U-Plane data from the DUT 46
b. If any of the test conditions is not true, the verdict for the whole test is "Fail" 47
c. If the DUT does not support initial conditions, the test verdict is "Inconclusive" 48
 49
 50
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended using reMask parameter 3GPP DL – 51
Resource allocation 52
The test description, execution and pass criteria is the same as described in section  3.2.3.7.4.  The only difference is that 53
the test setup is as described in section 3.2.1.1.2 Non-conducted OTA FDD tests for FR1 radios with a single signal 54
analyzer setup as described above in Figure 3.2.4.7-1. 55
A. Test Description and Applicability 56

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       182
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
This test is MANDATORY. 1
 2
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can accurately interpret C-Plane resource allocation messages with 3
the reMask parameter set, transfer U-Plane data into the correct resource elements and transmit this data accurately 4
in the downlink.  This test is applicable for Category A and Category B radios (No precoding is required).  The test 5
will be conducted therefore there will be no channel distortion or interference.  It is mandatory the radio pass this 6
test to be considered O-RAN conformant. 7
 8
This test requires non-zero data to populate all allocated resource blocks.  This data will be a PN23 sequence with a 9
seed value of all ones.  This test is applicable for both  Category A and  Category B radios.  10
 11
B. Test Entrance Criteria 12
 13
• The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1 of this document.  The test bandwidth is 20 14
MHz Bandwidth as described by E-TM1.1. 15
• The signal analyzer must have the ability to decode the downlink shared channel.  16
 17
C. Test Methodology 18
 19
a. Initial Conditions 20
• Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation 21
using M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.   22
• Connect the signal analyzer to the O-RU antenna ports or TAB connectors under test and configure the 23
analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and demodulate the transmitted signal .  24
• Ensure that the test antenna/s and TER equipment is calibrated within acceptable tolerance.  25
• Place the test antenna/s to a defined position within the OTA chamber as defined in 3.2.1.1.2 and 26
configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and demodulate the 27
transmitted signal. 28
• Place the O-RU into a test calibrated point within the OTA chamber as defined in 3.2.1.1.2. 29
• Align the O-RU to a default initial position, i.e. align the O-RU to the origin of coordinates of the 30
declared coordinate reference point and orientation in the OTA chamber as defined in 3.2.1.1.2.  31
• Let the DUT and TER to warm to the normal operating temperature within specified range.  32
 33
b. Procedure 34
• Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the E-TM1.1 signal described above in the CUSM-E.   35
• Use the CUSM-E control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that describe the signal.  36
• Every symbol should be described by a single type 1 section (DL-SCH and DCI) except symbols#6 37
which will be used for the reMask test. 38
• The data in this section must be a PN23 sequence using an initial seed of all ones. The first bits of the 39
PN23 will be in PRB1 and continue in consecutive resource elements to the end of PRB5. No section 40
type zero messages will be used for this test. 41
• Symbol number #6 should be stock data section type “D” as shown above.   42
• This test will only be using PRBs 1 through 5.  The corresponding C-Plane message will contain a 43
section IDs in a single C-Plane message describing symbol #6.  44
• The startSymbolid in the application header will be symbol #6.  45
• The C-Plane message will have one section with the reMask set to only the odd number resource 46
elements.  The number of PRBs will be 4. The start PRB will be 1. 47
• The corresponding U-Plane message will be a new PN23 Sequence (initial seed is all ones) in PRBs 1 48
through 5 of symbol #6. 49
 50
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  51
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for 52
this radio category (i.e., EVM). 53
2. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should only contain the same PN23 signals that were sent in the 54
U-Plane but only every other odd resource element. 55
 56

Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       183
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class With Precoding (WPR) TxD 1
The test description, execution and pass criteria is the same as described in section 3.2.3.7.5.  The only difference is that 2
the test setup is as described in section 3.2.1.1.2 Non-conducted OTA FDD tests for FR1 radios with two signal 3
analyzers setup as described above in Figure 3.2.4.7-2. 4
A. Test Description and Applicability 5
This test is MANDATORY. 6
 7
The purpose of this test is to validate the correct implementation of transmit diversity of a Category B O -RU with 8
two antennas.  TxD uses TM2 (transmission Mode 2).  For TxD, information for 2 layers are packed into a PRB for 9
transmission from O-DU and are unpacked at the O-RU.  TxD precoding is applied based on the C Plane 10
configuration before RF transmission.  11
 12
Using a standard E-TM1.1 test frame for FDD the CUSM-E (i.e., O-RAN interface of the TER described in section 13
3.2.2) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that require the O-RU to transmit on the downlink the standard 14
E-TM1.1 signal.   15
 16
This test is applicable for Category B radios only. 17
 18
B. Test Entrance Criteria 19
 20
• The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1 of this document.  The test bandwidth is 20 21
MHz Bandwidth as described by E-TM1.1. 22
• The O-RU must have at least two TRX chains with radiating antennas. 23
• The TER equipment must include 2 antennas with sufficient separation. The TER equipment must have at least 24
two probe receiving antennas to receive each individual layer. 25
• The signal analyzer must have the ability to decode the downlink shared channel.  26
• The O-RU must support the Section Extension ExtType=3 parameter as notified by the M-Plane 27
 28
C. Test Methodology 29
 30
a. Initial Conditions 31
 32
• Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation 33
using M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.   34
• Ensure that the test antenna/s and TER equipment is calibrated within acceptable toleran ce.  35
• Place the test antenna/s to a defined position within the OTA chamber as defined in 3.2.1.1.2 and configure 36
the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and demodulate the transmitted 37
signal. 38
• Place the O-RU into a test calibrated point within the OTA chamber as defined in 3.2.1.1.2. 39
• Align the O-RU to a default initial position, i.e. align the O-RU to the origin of coordinates of the declared 40
coordinate reference point and orientation in the OTA chamber as defined in 3.2.1.1.2.  41
• Let the DUT and TER to warm to the normal operating temperature within specified range.  42
 43
b. Procedure 44
 45
• Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the E-TM1.1 signal described above in the CUSM-E.  the data 46
content is a PN23 sequences starting with an initial seed of ones.   47
• Use the CUSM-E control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that describe the signal.  48
• Every symbol should be described by a single section (DL-SCH and DCI) using section type 1 messages. 49
No section type zero messages will be used for this test. 50
• The test configures two antenna ports hence two beamIDs needed (same beamID for user data and CRS 51
REs).  For Antenna Port 0, the beamId is contained in the C-Plane data section header, while the Antenna 52
Ports 1 (“beamIdAP1”) is contained in the ExtType=3 .  53
• Configure different eAxCs are used for each layer 54
• Configure following parameters in the Section Extension ExtType=3   55
o codebookIndex - ‘00000000’ (invalid) 56
o layerID (Layer ID for DL transmission) - layer ID that are used for DL transmission 57

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       184
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
o txScheme (transmission scheme) - ’txD’ 1
o numLayers (number of layers used for DL transmission) - 0001 (implies 2) 2
o crsReMask (CRS resource element mask)  3
o crsSymlNum (CRS symbol number indication) 4
o crsShift (crsShift used for DL transmission) 5
• Encapsulate the IQ data in U-Plane messages. Play those messages to the O-RU respecting timing windows 6
described in section 3.2.3.4.   7
• Repeat the entire frame the number of times required to synch the signal analyzer and allow it to demodulate 8
and decode the test frame. 9
 10
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  11
 12
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for 13
this radio category (i.e., EVM). 14
2. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should be the same as the signal described above and should 15
contain all the same PRB assignments and all the original PN23 data. 16
3. The signal relation between received signal analyzer or channels of the signal analyzer should match the 17
expected result for Tx Diversity transmission as specified in 3GPP TS 36.141 Section 4.5.1.1.  18
 19
 20
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class With Precoding (WPR) SM 21
The test description, execution and pass criteria is the same as described in section 3.2.3.7.6. The only difference is that 22
the test setup is as described in section 3.2.1.1.2 Non-conducted OTA FDD tests for FR1 radios with two signal 23
analyzers setup as described above in Figure 3.2.4.7-2. 24
A. Test Description and Applicability 25
This test is MANDATORY. 26
 27
The purpose of this test is to validate the correct implementation of TM3/4 Spatial Multiplexing transmission mode 28
for a Category B O-RU with two antennas.  For TM3/4 Spatial Multiplexing, information for 2 layers are packed 29
into a PRB for transmission from O-DU and are unpacked at the O-RU, subsequently TM3/4 based precoding is 30
applied based on the C Plane configuration before over the air transmission.  31
 32
Using a standard E-TM1.1 test frame for FDD the CUSM-E (i.e., O-RAN interface of the TER described in section 33
3.2.2) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that require the O-RU to transmit on the downlink the standard 34
E-TM1.1 signal.   35
 36
This test is applicable for Category B radios only. 37
 38
B. Test Entrance Criteria 39
 40
• The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1 of this document.  The test bandwidth is 20 41
MHz Bandwidth as described by E-TM1.1. 42
• The signal analyzer must have the ability to decode the downlink shared channel.  43
• The O-RU must have at least two TRX chains with radiating antennas. 44
• The TER equipment must include 2 antennas with sufficient separation. The TER equipment must have at least 45
two probe receiving antennas to receive each individual layer. 46
• The TER with connections to the O-RU must be calibrated. 47
 48
C. Test Methodology 49
 50
a. Initial Conditions 51
• Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation using 52
M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.   53
• Connect the signal analyzer to the O-RU TAB connectors under test and configure the analyzer with any 54
set-up information needed to allow it to synch and demodulate the transmitted signal.  55
• Ensure that the test antenna/s and TER equipment is calibrated within acceptable tolerance.  56

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       185
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
• Place the test antenna/s to a defined position within the OTA chamber as defined in 3.2.1.1.2 and configure 1
the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and demodulate the transmitted signal.  2
• Place the O-RU into a test calibrated point within the OTA chamber as defined in 3.2.1.1.2. 3
• Align the O-RU to a default initial position, i.e. align the O-RU to the origin of coordinates of the declared 4
coordinate reference point and orientation in the OTA chamber as defined in 3.2.1.1.2.  5
• Let the DUT and TER to warm to the normal operating temperature within specified range.  6
 7
b. Procedure 8
• Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the E-TM1.1 signal described above in the CUSM-E.  .  The data 9
content is a PN23 sequences starting with an initial seed of ones.   10
• The codeword -to-layer mapping follows table 6.3.3.2-1 of TS 36.211 with one codeword to two layer 11
mapping, but does not restrict to use two codeword to two layer mapping.   12
• Use the CUSM-E control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that describe the signal.  13
• Every symbol should be described by a single section (DL-SCH and DCI) using section type 1 messages. 14
No section type zero messages will be used for this test. 15
• The test configures two antenna ports.  Therefore, two beamIDs are needed.  The same beamID is used for 16
user data and CRS REs.   17
o For Antenna Port 0, the beamId is contained in the C-Plane data section header, while the 18
Antenna Ports 1 (“beamIdAP1”) is contained in the ExtType=3   19
• Configure following parameters in the Section Extension ExtType=3 as defined in CUS Plane Specification 20
[2].  21
o codebookIndex - indices of the precoder codebook that are used for precoding 22
o layerID (Layer ID for DL transmission) - layer ID that are used for DL transmission 23
o txScheme (transmission scheme) – set to Spatial multiplexing (no CDD) 24
o numLayers (number of layers used for DL transmission) – set to 0001 (implies 2) 25
o crsReMask (CRS resource element mask)  26
o crsSymlNum (CRS symbol number indication) 27
o crsShift (crsShift used for DL transmission) 28
 29
• Encapsulate the IQ data in U-Plane messages. Play those messages to the O-RU respecting timing windows 30
described in section 3.2.3.4.   31
• Repeat the entire frame the number of times required to synch the signal analyzer and allow it to demodulate 32
and decode the test frame. 33
 34
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  35
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for 36
this radio category (i.e., EVM). 37
2. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should be the same as the signal described above and should 38
contain all the same PRB assignments and all the original PN23. 39
3. The signal relation between the two signal analyzers or two channels of the signal analyzer should match the 40
expected result for MIMO transmission as specified in 3GPP TS 36.141 Section 4.5.1.1. 41

3.2.5 FR1 TDD Conducted Signal Tests 1
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class NR testing Generic (NRG)  2
All TDD tests described in this section will be combined UL and DL tests (i.e., a single test frame describing both up 3
link and down link). The default test frame used in this section is described in section 3.2.1.1.3 of this document.  There 4
are several variations on this test signal depending on the capabilities of the radio.  If the radio does not support the 5
numerology used in the example tests as reported in the M-plane it will be up to the test developer to modify their tests 6
to adapt to the radio.  This can usually be accomplished by using stock test patterns described above .  The test is 7
expected to follow the same spirit as the tests in this document but things like symbol numbers, number of PRBs, etc. 8
may have to be changed. 9
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Base 3GPP DL/UL 10
A. Test Description and Applicability 11
This test is MANDATORY. 12
 13
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can meet the most basic uplink and downlink requirements for O-14
RAN fronthaul using a TDD signal.  Subsequent tests will build on this to exercise additional capabilities of the 15
Fronthaul. 16
 17
Using the standard TDD test frame described in section 3.2.1.1.3 the O-DU emulator (i.e., O-RAN interface of the 18
TER described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that require the O-RU to transmit on the 19
down link and uplink the default signal.   20
 21
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can transmit and receive  a basic 3GPP, TDD test frame using the 22
default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.5 of this document (or a similar 3GPP waveform) except only one spatial 23
stream on one antenna will be used.  This test is applicable for Category A and Category B radios (No precoding 24
is required).  As per section 3.2.1.1.3 this test requires all-zero data to populate all allocated resource blocks.  This 25
configuration corresponds to stock data section A in all symbols that do not contain PDCCH channels. 26
 27
B. Test Entrance Criteria 28
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.3 of this document.  The test numerology will be 29
30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described by TM-FR1-TM1.1.  It will be for 5G New 30
Radio only. The radio must have conducted antenna ports (FR1) or TAB connectors.  31
 32
The O-RU must have a conducted antenna port (or TAB connector) to be connected to a signal analyzer and signal 33
source.  It must also support the default parameters defined in section 3.2.1.1.3 above. 34
 35
C. Test Methodology 36
a. Initial Conditions 37
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation 38
using M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer and 39
signal source to the O-RU antenna ports and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to 40
allow it to synch and demodulate the transmitted signal.   41
b. Procedure 42
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the signal described above in section 3.2.1.1.3 in the CUSM 43
emulator.  Built the appropriate test frame (uplink slots) for the signal source. Use the CUSM emulator 44
control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that describe the signal. Every symbol used in 45
the test should be described by a single section (DL-SCH that are used for the test, DMRS and DCI) using 46
section type 1 messages. No section type zero messages will be used for this test.  Encapsulate the IQ data 47
in U-Plane messages for downlink slots only. Play those messages to the O-RU respecting timing windows 48
described in section 3.2.1.1.3.  Repeat the entire frame the number of times required to synch the signal 49
analyzer and allow it to demodulate and decode the test frame.  It will be the responsibility of the TER’s 50
signal analyzer and source to coordinate downlink and uplink TDD transmissions.  The CUSM Emulator of 51
the TER is responsible for receiving uplink U-Plane messages, extracting IQ and decoding it to bits which 52
can be compared to those sent by the signal source. 53
 54
 55

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       187
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  1
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for 2
this radio category (i.e., EVM). 3
2. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should be the same as the signal described above.  If it contains 4
all the same PRB assignments and data, the test passes. 5
 6
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended 3GPP DL/UL – Resource Allocation 7
A. Test Description and Applicability 8
This test is MANDATORY. 9
 10
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can meet the extended uplink and downlink requirements for O-RAN 11
fronthaul using a TDD signal.  This test modifies the previous test by using a PN23 sequence in all test PDSCH 12
sections. 13
 14
Using the standard TDD test frame described in section 3.2.1.1.3 the O-DU emulator (i.e., O-RAN interface of the 15
TER described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that require the O-RU to transmit on the 16
down link and uplink the default signal.   17
 18
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can transmit and receive  an extended 3GPP TDD test frame using 19
the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.3 of this document (or a similar 3GPP waveform) except only one spatial 20
stream on one antenna will be used.  This test is applicable for Category A and Category B radios (No precoding 21
is required).  All downlink user data in this test will be a PN23 sequence and all uplink user data will also be a 22
PN23 sequence. 23
 24
B. Test Entrance Criteria 25
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.3 of this document.  The test numerology will be 26
30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described by TM-FR1-TM1.1.  It will be for 5G New 27
Radio only. The radio must have conducted antenna ports (FR1) or TAB connectors.  28
 29
The O-RU must have a conducted antenna port (or TAB connector) to be connected to a signal analyzer and signal 30
source.  It must also support the default parameters defined in section 3.2.1.1.1 above. 31
 32
C. Test Methodology 33
a. Initial Conditions 34
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation 35
using M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the 36
O-RU antenna port and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and 37
demodulate the transmitted signal.   38
b. Procedure 39
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the signal described above in section 3.2.1.1.3 in the CUSM 40
emulator. In this case use a PN23 sequence for the downlink shared channel.  Build the appropriate test 41
frame (uplink slots) for the signal source. Use the CUSM emulator control interface to build the appropriate 42
C-Plane messages that describe the uplink and downlink signals. Every symbol used in the test should be 43
described by a single section (DL-SCH that are used for the test, DMRS and DCI) using section type 1 44
messages. No section type zero messages will be used for this test.  Encapsulate the IQ data in U-Plane 45
messages for downlink slots only. Play those messages to the O-RU respecting timing windows described 46
in section 3.2.1.1.1.  Repeat the entire frame the number of times required to synch the signal analyzer and 47
allow it to demodulate and decode the test frame.  It will be the responsibility of the TER’s signal analyzer 48
and source to coordinate downlink and uplink TDD transmissions.  The CUSM Emulator of the TER is 49
responsible for receiving uplink U-Plane messages, extracting IQ and decoding it to bits which can be 50
compared to those sent by the signal source. 51
 52
 53

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       188
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  1
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for 2
this radio category (i.e., EVM). 3
2. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should be the same as the signal described above.  If it contains 4
all the same PRB assignments and all zero data, the test passes. 5
 6
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended using RB parameter 3GPP DL/UL – 7
Resource Allocation 8
A. Test Description and Applicability 9
This test is MANDATORY. 10
 11
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can accurately interpret C-Plane resource allocation messages with 12
the rb parameter set, transfer U-Plane data into the correct resource blocks and transmit this data accurately in the 13
downlink and interpret and capture the correct resource blocks in the uplink with the rb parameter set.    This test 14
uses a PN23 sequence in all test PDSCH sections. 15
 16
Using the standard TDD test frame described in section 3.2.1.1.3 the O-DU emulator (i.e., O-RAN interface of the 17
TER described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that require the O-RU to transmit on the 18
down link and uplink the specified signal using the rb bit in both uplink and downlink.   19
 20
Only one spatial stream on one antenna will be used.  This test is applicable for Category A and Category B radios 21
(No precoding is required).  All downlink user data in this test will be a PN23 sequence and all uplink user data 22
will also be a PN23 sequence. 23
 24
B. Test Entrance Criteria 25
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.3 of this document.  The test numerology will be 26
30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described in section 3.2.1.1.3.  It will be for 5G New 27
Radio only. The radio must have conducted antenna ports (FR1) or TAB connectors.  28
 29
The O-RU must have a conducted antenna port (or TAB connector) to be connected to a signal analyzer.  It must 30
also support the default parameters defined in section 3.2.1.1.1 above. 31
 32
C. Test Methodology 33
a. Initial Conditions 34
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation 35
using M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the 36
O-RU antenna port and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and 37
demodulate the transmitted signal.  Connect the signal source to the O-RU antenna port and configure it as 38
described below. 39
b.  Procedure 40
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the signal described above in section 3.2.1.1.3 in the CUSM 41
emulator. In this case use a PN23 sequence for the downlink shared channel.  Build the appropriate test 42
frame (uplink slots) for the signal source. Use the CUSM emulator control int erface to build the appropriate 43
C-Plane messages that describe the uplink and downlink signals. Every symbol used in the test should be 44
described by a single section (DL-SCH that are used for the test, DMRS and DCI) using section type 1 45
messages. No section type zero messages will be used for this test.  Encapsulate the IQ data in U -Plane 46
messages for downlink slots only. Play those messages to the O-RU respecting timing windows described 47
in section 3.2.1.1.3.  Repeat the entire frame the number of times required to synch the signal analyzer and 48
allow it to demodulate and decode the test frame.  It will be the responsibility of the TER’s signal analyzer 49
and source to coordinate downlink and uplink TDD transmissions.  The CUSM Emulator of the TER is 50
responsible for receiving uplink U-Plane messages, extracting IQ and decoding it to bits which can be 51
compared to those sent by the signal source. 52
 53
For the downlink slots and symbols:  54
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the NR-FR1-TM1.1 signal described above in the O-DU emulator.  55
Use the O-DU emulator control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that describe the signal.  56
Every allocated (see below) symbol should be described by sections (DL -SCH and DCI) using section type 1 57

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       189
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
messages.  No section type zero messages will be used for this test.  Symbol #3 of each slot should be Stock 1
data section type 6 “D”  as shown in section 3.2.1.1.5 above. The control plane for symbol #3 will only 2
include PRBs number 5 through 23. C-Plane messages will have the rb bit set to one for this section. All 3
other DL-SCH symbols and PRBs other than PRBs 5-23 will not contain data.  There are two ways to 4
conduct the test: 5
1. A single data section with the rb bit set and a PN23 sequence sent as shown below:  6
 7
A new PN23 sequence will be started but every other PRB will contain only the odd parts of the PN23 8
sequence (as shown in green).  The other PRBs (shown in orange) will not contain data and will not be sent to 9
the O-RU.  Thus, a single data section will be used, and the corresponding U -Plane message will only contain 10
data for the odd PRBs as shown above.  The parts of the PN23 sequence not used (shown marked with an X) 11
will be discarded. 12
2. Two data sections one containing the odd parts of the PN23 sequence and the other containing the even 13
parts as shown below: 14
 15
A new PN23 sequence will be started but every other PRB in one section will contain only the odd parts of 16
the PN23 sequence (as shown in green).  The second data section will contain the even parts of the PN23 17
sequence.  The C-Plane messages for both sections will use the rb bit. The U-Plane messages 18
corresponding to the first data section will contain only the odd parts of the PN23 sequence, the U -Plane 19
message corresponding to the second data section will only contain the even parts.  Thus, a c ontinuous 20
PN23 sequence will be sent only in PRBs 5 through 23. 21

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       190
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
Additional sections should be included to describe the DCI symbols as well as Reference Signals described 1
in 38.141-1 Play those messages to the O-RU respecting timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.1.  2
Repeat the entire frame the number of times required to synch the signal analyzer and allow it to 3
demodulate and decode the test frame.  4
 5
• For the uplink sections and symbols: Load uplink test waveform (G-FR1-A1-5 : 6
SCS30k_51RB) on the RF Signal Source.  Note this signal has a PN23 sequence as user data.  7
Configure the Signal Source to play the  TDD test waveforms on 10ms frame boundaries starting 8
when it receives a trigger signal from the O-DU emulator that all C-Plane messages have been 9
sent.  Ensure the O-RU and source are synchronized so downlink slots do not conflict with uplink 10
slots. Load C-Plane message sequence on Test Equipment O-RU (TER) – In this test only symbol 11
number 6 will be used and all 51 PRBs will be used.  All other symbols  will not contain data 12
except required DRMS signals which may be used to synchronize test equipment. There are two 13
options for conducting this test: 14
1. A single data section with the rb bit set and a PN23 sequence sent as shown below:15
 16
A new PN23 sequence will be started but every other PRB will contain only the odd parts of 17
the PN23 sequence (as shown in orange).  The other PRBs (shown in white) will not contain 18
data and will not be sent to the O-RU.  Thus, a single data section will be used, and the 19
corresponding U-Plane message will only contain data for the odd PRBs as shown above.  20
The parts of the PN23 sequence not used (shown marked with an X) will be discarded.  21
2. Two data sections one containing the odd parts of the PN23 sequence and the other 22
containing the even parts as shown below: 23

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       191
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
 1
A new PN23 sequence will be started but every other PRB in one section will contain only the odd parts of 2
the PN23 sequence (as shown in green).  The second data section will contain the even parts of the P N23 3
sequence.  The C-Plane messages for both sections will use the rb bit. The U-Plane messages 4
corresponding to the first data section will contain only the odd parts of the PN23 sequence, the U -Plane 5
message corresponding to the second data section will only contain the even parts.  Thus, a continuous 6
PN23 sequence will be sent only in PRBs 0 through 51 7
 8
 9
Steps: 10
• Arm Test Equipment O-RU (TER) to capture DUT fronthaul Messages  11
• Launch test to play the C-Plane messages and the downlink U-Plane messages and trigger the 12
source to play the RF signal on a frame boundary.  13
• Play messages to the O-RU respecting the timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.1.  Repeat 14
the entire frame the number of times required to synch the signal analyzer and allow it to 15
demodulate and decode the frame. 16
• Record U-Plane messages from DUT for a complete frame and the eAxC corresponding to the 17
Antenna port  18
• Extract IQ information from the captured U-Plane messages 19
• Extract IQ information from the signal analyzer for downlink slots 20
• Extract Payload for both signals 21
• Compare payload binary sequences  22
 23
 24

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       192
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  1
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for 2
this radio category (i.e., EVM). 3
2. The signal extracted by the U-Plane messages (uplink) should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance 4
requirement for this radio category (i.e., EVM). 5
3. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should be the same as the signal described above.  If it contains 6
all the same PRB assignments and all zero data, the downlink test passes. 7
4. The test frame extracted from the uplink U-Plane messages should be the same as the uplink signal described 8
above.  If it contains all the same PRB assignments and all zero data, the uplink test passes. 9
 10
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended using SymInc parameter 3GPP DL/UL – 11
Resource Allocation 12
A. Test Description and Applicability 13
This test is CONDITIONAL MANDATORY. 14
 15
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can accurately interpret C-Plane resource allocation messages with 16
the SymInc parameter set, transfer U-Plane data into the correct resource blocks and transmit this data accurately in 17
the downlink and interpret and capture the correct resource blocks in the uplink with the SymInc parameter set.    18
This test uses a PN23 sequence in all test PDSCH sections. 19
 20
Using the standard TDD test frame described in section 3.2.1.1.3 the O-DU emulator (i.e., O-RAN interface of the 21
TER described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that require the O-RU to transmit on the 22
down link and uplink the specified signal using the SymInc bit in both uplink and downlink.   23
 24
Only one spatial stream on one antenna will be used.  This test is applicable for Category A and Category B radios 25
(No precoding is required).  All downlink user data in this test will be a PN23 sequence and all uplink user data 26
will also be a PN23 sequence. 27
 28
B. Test Entrance Criteria 29
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.3 of this document.  The test numerology will be 30
30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described in section 3.2.1.1.3.  It will be for 5G New Radio 31
only. The radio must have conducted antenna ports (FR1) or TAB connectors.  32
 33
The radio must support the SymInc Parameter as notified by the M-Plane.  The Signal Analyzer must have the 34
ability to decode the downlink shared channel. 35
 36
 37
C. Test Methodology 38
a. Initial Conditions 39
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation 40
using M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the 41
O-RU antenna port and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and 42
demodulate the transmitted signal.  Connect the signal source to the O-RU antenna port and configure it as 43
described below. 44
b. Procedure 45
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the signal described above in section 3.2.1.1.3 in the CUSM 46
emulator. In this case use a PN23 sequence for the downlink shared channel.  Build the appropriate test 47
frame (uplink slots) for the signal source. Use the CUSM emulator control interface to build the appropriate 48
C-Plane messages that describe the uplink and downlink signals. Every symbol used in the test should be 49
described by a single section (DL-SCH that are used for the test, DMRS and DCI) using section type 1 50
messages. No section type zero messages will be used for this test.  Encapsulate the IQ data in U-Plane 51
messages for downlink slots only. Play those messages to the O-RU respecting timing windows described 52
in section 3.2.1.1.3.  Repeat the entire frame the number of times required to synch the signal analyzer and 53
allow it to demodulate and decode the test frame.  It will be the responsibility of the TER’s signal analyzer 54
and source to coordinate downlink and uplink TDD transmissions.  The CUSM Emulator of the TER is 55
responsible for receiving uplink U-Plane messages, extracting IQ and decoding it to bits which can be 56
compared to those sent by the signal source. 57
 58

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       193
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
 1
For the downlink slots and symbols: Every symbol should be described by a single type 1 section (DL-2
SCH and DCI) except symbols #5 and #6 which will be used for the SymInc test. The data in these sections 3
must be a PN23 sequence using an initial seed of all ones. Each symbol should be a new PN23 sequence, 4
that is PRB 0 should contain the data from a new PN23 sequence for each symbol. Symbols number 5 and 5
6 should be stock data sections type “E” as shown above.  This stock data section consists of two adjacent 6
symbols each containing two sections.  The corresponding C-Plane message will contain 4 section IDs in a 7
single C-Plane message describing symbols #5 and #6.  The startSymbolId in the application header will be 8
symbol #5. The second section ID for symbol #5 will have the SymInc bit set informing the O -RU that the 9
next section will begin describing symbol #6. The corresponding U-Plane messages will be a new PN23 10
Sequence for each symbol (5 and 6). Additional sections should be included to describe the DCI symbols as 11
well as Reference Signals described in 38.141-1.  12
 13
For the uplink sections and symbols: Load uplink test waveform (G-FR1-A1-5 : SCS30k_51RB, 100 14
MHz) on the RF Signal Source.  Note this signal has a PN23 sequence as user data.  Configure the source 15
to generate a new PN23 sequence in symbols #5 and #6.  Configure the Signal Source to play test 16
waveforms on 10ms frame boundaries starting when it receives a trigger signal  from the O-DU emulator 17
that all C-Plane messages have been sent.  Ensure the O-RU and source are synchronized so downlink slots 18
do not conflict with uplink slots.  Load C-Plane message sequence on Test Equipment O-RU (TER) – Only 19
symbols #5 and #6 in each slot will be used in this test. All other symbols will contain either reference 20
signals or data but will not be considered part of the test.  These two symbols will be used to determine 21
whether the radio properly increments the current symbol ID when the SymInc bit is set. The C-Plane 22
message for symbol #5 should have the SymInc bit set.  This message should have a second section 23
describing symbol #6 (using the SymInc mechanism).  All PRBs in each symbol will be requested (In the 24
example waveform 51 PRBs). 25
 26
Steps: 27
• Arm Test Equipment O-RU (TER) to capture DUT fronthaul Messages  28
• Launch test to play the C-Plane messages and the downlink U-Plane messages and trigger the 29
source to play the RF signal on a frame boundary.  30
• Play messages to the O-RU respecting the timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.1.  Repeat 31
the entire frame the number of times required to synch the signal analyzer and allow it to 32
demodulate and decode the frame. 33
• Record U-Plane messages from DUT for a complete frame and the eAxC corresponding to the 34
Antenna port  35
• Extract IQ information from the captured U-Plane messages 36
• Extract IQ information from the signal analyzer for downlink slots 37
• Extract Payload for both signals 38
• Compare payload binary sequences  39
 40
 41
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  42
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for 43
this radio category (i.e., EVM). 44
2. The signal extracted by the U-Plane messages (uplink) should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance 45
requirement for this radio category (i.e., EVM). 46
3. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should be the same as the signal described above.  If it  contains 47
all the same PRB assignments and the correct PN23 data, the downlink test passes. 48
4. The test frame extracted from the uplink U-Plane messages should be the same as the uplink signal described 49
above.  If it contains all the same PRB assignments and correct PN23 data, the uplink test passes. 50
 51

 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended using reMask parameter 3GPP DL/UL – 1
Resource Allocation 2
A. Test Description and Applicability 3
This test is MANDATORY. 4
 5
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can accurately interpret C-Plane resource allocation messages with 6
the reMask parameter set, transfer U-Plane data into the correct resource blocks and transmit this data accurately in 7
the downlink and interpret and capture the correct resource blocks in the uplink with the reMask parameter set.    8
This test uses a PN23 sequence in all test PDSCH sections. 9
 10
Using the standard TDD test frame described in section 3.2.1.1.3 the O-DU emulator (i.e., O-RAN interface of the 11
TER described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that require the O-RU to transmit on the 12
down link and uplink the specified signal using the rb bit in both uplink and downlink.   13
 14
Only one spatial stream on one antenna will be used.  This test is applicable for Category A and Category B radios  15
(No precoding is required).  All downlink user data in this test will be a PN23 sequence and all uplink user data 16
will also be a PN23 sequence. 17
 18
B. Test Entrance Criteria 19
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.3 of this document.  The test numerology will be 20
30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described in section 3.2.1.1.3.  It will be for 5G New Radio 21
only. The radio must have conducted antenna ports (FR1) or TAB connectors.  22
 23
The radio must support the reMask Parameter as notified by the M-Plane.  The Signal Analyzer must have the 24
ability to decode the downlink shared channel. 25
 26
C. Test Methodology 27
a. Initial Conditions 28
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation 29
using M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the 30
O-RU antenna port and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and 31
demodulate the transmitted signal.  Connect the signal source to the O-RU antenna port and configure it as 32
described below. 33
b. Procedure 34
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the signal described above in section 3.2.1.1.3 in the CUSM 35
emulator and modified as described below. In this case use a PN23 sequence for the downlink shared 36
channel.  Build the appropriate test frame (uplink slots) as described below for the signal source. Use the 37
CUSM emulator control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that describe the uplink and 38
downlink signals. Every symbol used in the test should be described (DL-SCH that are used for the test, 39
DMRS and DCI) using section type 1 messages. No section type zero messages will be  used for this test.  40
Encapsulate the IQ data in U-Plane messages for downlink slots only. Play those messages to the O-RU 41
respecting timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.3.  Repeat the entire frame the number of times 42
required to synch the signal analyzer and allow it to demodulate and decode the test frame.  It will be the 43
responsibility of the TER’s signal analyzer and source to coordinate downlink and uplink TDD 44
transmissions.  The CUSM Emulator of the TER is responsible for receiving uplink U -Plane messages, 45
extracting IQ and decoding it to bits which can be compared to those sent by the signal source.  46
 47
For the downlink slots and symbols:  48
Use the O-DU emulator control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that describe the 49
signal as described below. Every symbol allocated should be described by type 1 sections (DL-SCH and 50
DCI).   Only symbol #2 will be used for the reMask test. The data in this section must be a PN23 51
sequence using an initial seed of all ones. The first bits of the PN23 will be in PRB1 and continue in 52
consecutive resource elements to the end of PRB5. No section type zero messages will be used for this 53
test.  The PN23 sequence will be interleaved with DMRS signals as shown below: 54
 55

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       195
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
 1
 2
Symbol number 2 should be stock data section type “D” as shown above.  This test will only be using 3
PRBs 1 through 5.  The corresponding C-Plane message will contain two section IDs in a single C-4
Plane message describing symbol #2.  The startSymbolId in the application header will be symbol #2. 5
The C-Plane message will have one section with the reMask set to only the odd number resource 6
elements and another section with the reMask set to the even elements.  The number of PRBs will be 4. 7
The start PRB will be 1. 8
 9
 10
The corresponding U-Plane messages will be a new PN23 Sequence (initial seed is all ones) in PRBs 1 11
through 5 of symbol #2 and another U-Plane message containing DMRS signals. 12
For the uplink sections and symbols:  13
Load C-Plane message sequence on Test Equipment O-RU (TER) symbol #2 in each slot will be used to 14
determine whether the radio properly transmits only every other resource element when the reMask is set. 15
No other symbols will be used in this test, however other symbols containing reference signals may be 16
used to ensure the O-RU can synchronize with the TER.  The format of symbol #2 used in this test will 17
be: 18
 19
 20
 21
The TER will not request any other symbols from the O-RU in this test unless they are needed by the 22
TER for synchronization.  The C-Plane message for symbol #2 should have the reMask set to tell the 23
radio to send PN23 user data only every even resource element. The odd resource elements should be 24
requested using a second data section with reMask indicating only every odd RE should be sent. Only the 25
PRBs 1 through 5 will be used in this section (matching stock data section type “D”). The number of 26
PRBs will be 4 and the start PRB will be 1. 27

 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended using Non-contiguous PRB Allocation 29
Section Extension 3GPP DL/UL – Resource Allocation 30
A. Test Description and Applicability 31
This test is CONDITIONAL MANDATORY. 32
 33
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can accurately interpret C-Plane resource allocation messages with 34
section extension 6, transfer U-Plane data into the correct resource blocks and transmit this data accurately in the 35
downlink and interpret and capture the correct resource blocks in the uplink with section extension 6.    This test 36
uses a PN23 sequence in all test PDSCH sections. 37
 38
Using the standard TDD test frame described in section 3.2.1.1.3 the O-DU emulator (i.e., O-RAN interface of the 39
TER described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that require the O-RU to transmit on the 40
down link and uplink the specified signal using section extension 6 in both uplink and downlink.   41
 42
In this test stock data section definition C will be used to exercise the non -contiguous RB allocation, all 273 PRBs 43
(51 in the uplink slots)or the max number of PRBs per symbol for the highest numerology the radio supports will 44
be used in this test. 45
 46
Only one spatial stream on one antenna will be used.  This test is applicable for Category A and Category B radios 47
(No precoding is required).  All downlink user data in this test will be a PN23 sequence and all uplink user data 48
will also be a PN23 sequence. 49
 50
B. Test Entrance Criteria 51
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.3 of this document.  The test numerology will be 52
30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described in section 3.2.1.1.3.  It will be for 5G New Radio 53
only. The radio must have conducted antenna ports (FR1) or TAB connectors.  54
 55
The radio must support section extension 6 as notified by the M-Plane.  The Signal Analyzer must have the ability 56
to decode the downlink shared channel. 57
 58

C. Test Methodology 1
a. Initial Conditions 2
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation 3
using M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the 4
O-RU antenna port and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and 5
demodulate the transmitted signal.  Connect the signal source to the O-RU antenna port and configure it as 6
described below. 7
b. Procedure 8
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the signal described above in section 3.2.1.1.3 in the CUSM 9
emulator. In this case use a PN23 sequence for the downlink shared channel.  Build the appropriate test 10
frame (uplink slots) for the signal source. Use the CUSM emulator control interface to build the appropriate 11
C-Plane messages that describe the uplink and downlink signals. Every symbol used in the test should be 12
described by a single section (DL-SCH that are used for the test, DMRS and DCI) using section type 1 13
messages. No section type zero messages will be used for this test.  Encapsulate the IQ data in U-Plane 14
messages for downlink slots only. Play those messages to the O-RU respecting timing windows described 15
in section 3.2.1.1.1.  Repeat the entire frame the number of times required to synch the signal analyzer and 16
allow it to demodulate and decode the test frame.  It will be the responsibility of the TER’s signal analyzer 17
and source to coordinate downlink and uplink TDD transmissions.  The CUSM Emulator of the TER is 18
responsible for receiving uplink U-Plane messages, extracting IQ and decoding it to bits which can be 19
compared to those sent by the signal source. 20
 21
 22
For the downlink slots and symbols: Only symbols number 6 and 7 will be used in each slot.  Other 23
symbols may contain data including reference signals to ensure test equipment can synchronize with the 24
signal.  The starting PRB will be zero and number of PRBs will be chosen from one or more columns in 25
Table 3.2.3.1-2 below.  The resource block group size will be 16 based on 3GPP 38.214 Table 5.1.2.2.1-1 26
as shown in Table 3.2.3.1-1 below using configuration 2.   27

Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the NR-FR1-TM1.1 signal described above in the O-DU emulator.  3
Use the O-DU emulator control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that describe the signal. 4
Every symbol should be described by a single type 1 section (DL-SCH and DCI) except symbols 5
#6 and #7 which will be used for the section extension 6 test. The data in symbol #6 should be a new PN23 6
sequence starting in the first PRB and continuing to PRB 273 (RBG number 17).  Symbol #7 should be 7
identical to symbol #6.  The rbgMask value should be set to 1011111111111111111111111111b and the 8
symbolMask value should be set to 000000110000000b.  No section type zero messages will be used for this 9
test. 10
 11
The O-DU emulator will build a U-Plane message containing the PN23 IQ data for the first 16 PRBs (RBG 0), 12
this message will have the section ID used in the C-Plane message described above.  Another U-Plane message 13
will be created using the same section ID but with the PN23 data for RBGs 2-17 in it.  The same U-Plane 14
messages will be used for symbol #7. 15
 16
For the uplink sections and symbols: For this test symbols number 6 and 7 will be used in each slot.  The 17
starting PRB will be zero and number of PRBs will be 51.  The resource block group size will be 8.  Using the 18
calculations in the O-RAN fronthaul specification section 5.4.7.6 the ID of the last RBG will be 6, f(0) will be 8, 19
f(n) will be 8 and f(lastRbgID) will be 3.   20
Every symbol should be described by a single type 1 section (DL-SCH and DCI) except symbols #6 and #7 21
which will be used for the section extension 6 test. The data in symbol #6 is expected to be a new PN23 22
sequence starting in the first PRB and continuing to PRB 51 (RBG number 66).  Symbol #7 should be identical 23
to symbol #6.  The rbgMask value should be set to 1010000000000000000000000000b  and the symbolMask 24
value should be set to 000000110000000b.  No section type zero messages will be used for this test.  If the radio 25
only supports another numerology see the tables above in the downlink sections and symbols for appropriate 26
modifications. 27

 UC- Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended 3GPP DL/UL – Resource Allocation – 14
Coupling C and U plane via time and frequency 15
A. Test Description and Applicability 16
This test is CONDITIONAL MANDATORY. 17
 18
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can meet the extended uplink and downlink requirements for O-RAN 19
fronthaul using a TDD signal.  This test uses time and frequency to couple C-Plane and U-Plane messages. 20
 21
Using the standard TDD test frame described in section 3.2.1.1.3 the O-DU emulator (i.e., O-RAN interface of the 22
TER described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that require the O-RU to transmit on the 23
down link and uplink the default signal.   24
 25
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can transmit and receive  an extended 3GPP TDD test frame using 26
the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.3 of this document (or a similar 3GPP waveform) except only one spatial 27
stream on one antenna will be used.  This test is applicable for Category A and Category B radios (No precoding 28
is required).  All downlink user data in this test will be a PN23 sequence and all uplink user data will also be a 29
PN23 sequence. The radio must report over the M-Plane that it supports C and U plane coupling via time and 30
frequency. 31
 32
B. Test Entrance Criteria 33
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.3 of this document.  The test numerology will be 34
30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described by TM-FR1-TM1.1.  It will be for 5G New 35
Radio only. The radio must report over the M-Plane that it supports C and U plane coupling via time and 36
frequency. 37
 38
The O-RU must have a conducted antenna port (or TAB connector) to be connected to a signal analyzer and signal 39
source.  It must also support the default parameters defined in section 3.2.1.1.1 above. 40
 41
C. Test Methodology 42
a. Initial Conditions 43
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation 44
using M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the 45
O-RU antenna port and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and 46
demodulate the transmitted signal.   47
b. Procedure 48
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the signal described above in section 3.2.1.1.3 in the CUSM 49
emulator. In this case use a PN23 sequence for the downlink shared channel.  Build the appropriate test 50
frame (uplink slots) for the signal source. Use the CUSM emulator control interface to build the appropriate 51
C-Plane messages that describe the uplink and downlink signals. Every symbol used in the test should be 52
described by a single section (DL-SCH that are used for the test, DMRS and DCI) using section type 1 53
messages. No section type zero messages will be used for this test.  Encapsulate the IQ data in U-Plane 54
messages for downlink slots only. Play those messages to the O-RU respecting timing windows described 55
in section 3.2.1.1.1.  Repeat the entire frame the number of times required to synch the signal analyzer and 56
allow it to demodulate and decode the test frame.  It will be the responsibility of the TER’s signal analyzer 57
and source to coordinate downlink and uplink TDD transmissions.  The CUSM Emulator of the TER is 58

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       200
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
responsible for receiving uplink U-Plane messages, extracting IQ and decoding it to bits which can be 1
compared to those sent by the signal source.  All section IDs in C-Plane messages and downlink U-Plane 2
messages must be 4095. 3
 4
C-Plane and Downlink U-Plane messages sent by the TER will have valid values in the following fields: 5
• EAxC ID 6
• Datadirection bit  7
• Frame ID, subframeID, slotID, startsymbolID, and NumSymbol 8
• SectionID must have a value 4095 9
• SymInc, rb reMask and section extension #6 are not used in this test 10
 11
It is the responsibility of the TER to properly arrange uplink U-Plane messages using only time and 12
frequency resources. 13
 14
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  15
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for 16
this radio category (i.e., EVM). 17
2. All received U-Plane messages must have section ID equal to 4095 18
3. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should be the same as the signal described above.  If it contains 19
all the same PRB assignments and all zero data, the test passes. 20
 21
 UC- Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended 3GPP DL/UL – Coupling C and U plane via 22
Time and Frequency and Section Description Priorities 23
A. Test Description and Applicability 24
This test is CONDITIONAL MANDATORY. 25
 26
The purpose of this test is to test whether the radio can implement coupling U and C plane via time and frequency 27
and section description priorities requirements for O-RAN fronthaul using a TDD signal.  This test combines the 28
FDD, uplink and downlink tests for these same features. 29
 30
Starting with the standard TDD test frame described in section 3.2.1.1.3 the O-DU emulator (i.e., O-RAN interface 31
of the TER described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that require the O-RU to transmit 32
on the down link and uplink the signals described below.   33
 34
Only one spatial stream on one antenna will be used.  This test is applicable for Category A and Category B radios 35
(No precoding is required).  All downlink user data in this test will be a PN23 sequence and all uplink user data 36
will also be a PN23 sequence. 37
 38
B. Test Entrance Criteria 39
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.3 of this document and those specified below.  40
The test numerology will be 30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described by TM-FR1-41
TM1.1.  It will be for 5G New Radio only. The radio must have conducted antenna ports (FR1) or TAB 42
connectors.  It will be a TDD signal. 43
 44
The O-RU must have a conducted antenna port (or TAB connector) to be connected to a signal analyzer and signal 45
source.  It must also support the default parameters defined in section 3.2.1.1.1 above. 46
 47
C. Test Methodology 48
a. Initial Conditions 49
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation 50
using M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the 51
O-RU antenna port and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and 52
demodulate the transmitted signal.   53
b. Procedure 54
Build an appropriate C and U plane signals for the signals described below in the CUSM emulator. Every 55
slot used in the test should be described by a single C-Plane message with multiple sections (DL-SCH that 56
are used for the test, DMRS and DCI) using a section type 1 message. No section type zero messages will 57

be used for this test.  Encapsulate the IQ data in U-Plane messages for downlink slots only. Play those 1
messages to the O-RU respecting timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.1.  Repeat the entire frame 2

 11
In this test the section configuration will be as shown in Table 3.2.5.1-3 above.  The 6 sections will comprise 12
one slot and this slot will be repeated continuously in the downlink slots in the TDD frame to synchronize the 13
TER signal analyzer.  The six sections will be sent on one C-Plane message using C and U plane coupling 14
via time and frequency.  The configuration above follows the example given in the CUSM specification.  15
The section numbers in the above table do not represent SectionID numbers but individual sections. Sections 16
#1 and #2 describe hypothetical DMRS signals sent in symbols #2 and #11 in each slot.  These signals have 17
every other subcarrier masked by reMask. This is the same as shown above in the standard NR-FR1-TM1.1 18
test signal shown above. The DMRS signals in symbol #2 have beam ID 1 and symbol #11 have beam ID  2.  19
These sections use section extension 6 and contain a higher priority than all other sections.  20
Section #3 describes PN23 data sent to hypothetical UE #1 it overlaps REs in sections #1 and #2 but has a 21
lower priority so sections #1 and #2 are valid.  Since section #3 has contiguous symbols section extension 6 22
is not needed. 23
Section #4 is for hypothetical UE #2. It occupies the same symbols as the DMRS signals but uses a different 24
reMask.  Since the symbols are not contiguous it uses sections extension 6 but the priority is set to the default 25
0. 26

Section #5 is for hypothetical UE #3 and uses a contiguous set of symbols so section extension 6 is not 1
needed.  It does not overlap any other signals.  This section is optional because it does not test  Section 2
Description Priority. 3
Section #6 is a hypothetical special channel using only one symbol and does not require section extension 6.  4
This section is also optional. 5
U-Plane messages will contain: 6
• DMRS signals for every odd resource element as described by section #1 for symbol #11 7
• DMRS signals for every odd resource element as described by section #2 for symbol #2  8
• A new PN23 sequence in each of the first 5 symbols as described in section #3.  Note that for 9
symbol #2 the PN sequence will be pierced by the DMRS signals. 10
• A new PN23 sequence for symbol #6 as described by section #4 as well as a new PN sequence for 11
symbol #11.  These sequences are only 32 PRBs long and start in PRB 15. The sequence in symbol 12
#11 will be pierced by DMRS signals. 13
• The user data for sections number #5 and #6 are standard PN23 sequences only for these symbols 14
and PRBs described in the table above. 15

and PRBs described in the table above. 31

trigger signal from the O-DU emulator that C-Plane messages have been sent. 33

• Datadirection bit (Uplink) 37

windows  42
