 TDD UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Compression Static Format (SF) Fixed-Point 3
(FP)  4
A. Test Description and Applicability 5
This test is CONDITIONALMANDATORY and shall be performed if the O-RU supports this compression format. 6
 7
The purpose of this test is to: 8
• Validate correct encoding of IQ data under the following conditions.  9
o RU Static compression configurations 10
o Fixed point IQ data format 11
o Selection of 2 supported bit width: 9 bits, 14 bits  12
o Uplink / downlink 13
• Validate that in the U-Plane PRB header, the udCompHeader, “reserved” and udCompParam fields are 14
not present  15
 16
B. Test Entrance Criteria 17
The test uses the setup and methodology described in section 3.2.1.1. 18
 19
 20
C. Test Methodology 21
a.  Initial Conditions 22
• The O-RU is started 23
• Fronthaul Ethernet interface configured for communication between TER and the DUT.  24
• O-RU synchronized with TER using S-Plane 25
• Communication established between TER and the DUT such that it is possible to exchange U-Plane and 26
C-Plane messages  27
• Signal Analyzer connected to DUT’s antenna port and setup according to DUT RF output configuration  28
• Signal Source connected to DUT’s antenna port and setup according to DUT RF input configuration 29
 30
b.  Procedure 31
For each supported bit width (9 bits, 14 bits), the following tests need to be performed:  32
  33
1. Launch Uncompressed Test  34
• Via the M-Plane or another suitable mechanism, put the O-RU into a static configuration with the downlink 35
and uplink configured as follows: no compression, (16 bits) 36
• Arm Signal Analyzers and Signal Source 37
o Arm Signal analyzer to capture the next Frame  38
o Arm Signal Source to generate the Frame NR-FR1-CMP-TST-FRAME-UL 39
• Arm the CUSM emulator to send the TDD O-RAN test frame, including 40
o Downlink: CU-plane of “uncompressed” NR-FR1-TDD-CMP-TST-ST-DL-UNC-16B test stimulus 41
file to the DUT 42
o Uplink: C-plane of “uncompressed” NR-FR1-TDD-CMP-TST-ST-UL-UNC-16B test stimulus file 43
to the DUT 44

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       231
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
• ARM CUSM-E to capture the Uplink U-Plane Data from the DUT 1
• Launch the test until: 2
o RF Signal Analyzer has captured the downlink frame 3
o CUSM-E has captured the uplink U_plane data  4
2. Uncompressed Downlink Measurements  5
• With the RF Signal Analyzer, perform the 3 power measurements  6
o CMP-Uncompressed-Measured-Power-DL-PDSCH0 in dBm 7
o CMP-Uncompressed-Measured-Power-DL-PDSCH1 in dBm 8
o CMP-Uncompressed-Measured-Power-DL PDSCH2 in dBm 9
• With the RF Signal Analyzer, perform the 3 EVM measurements  10
o CMP-Uncompressed-Measured-EVM-DL-PDSCH0 in % 11
o CMP-Uncompressed-Measured-EVM-DL-PDSCH1 in % 12
o CMP-Uncompressed-Measured-EVM-DL-PDSCH2 in % 13
• With the RF Signal Analyzer, check Data integrity measurements  14
o CMP-Uncompressed-BER-DL-PDSCH0  15
o CMP-Uncompressed-BER-DL-PDSCH1  16
o CMP-Uncompressed-BER-DL-PDSCH2 17
3. Uncompressed Uplink Measurements  18
• Extract IQ information from Capture U-Plane trace of the CUSM-E 19
• Using the Signal Analyzer software, perform the 3 power measurements  20
o CMP-Uncompressed-Measured-Power-UL-PDSCH0 in dBm 21
o CMP-Uncompressed-Measured-Power-UL-PDSCH1 in dBm 22
o CMP-Uncompressed-Measured-Power-UL-PDSCH2 in dBm 23
 24
• Using the Signal Analyzer software, perform the 3 EVM measurements  25
o CMP-Uncompressed-Measured-EVM-UL-PDSCH0 in % 26
o CMP-Uncompressed-Measured-EVM-UL-PDSCH1 in % 27
o CMP-Uncompressed-Measured-EVM-UL-PDSCH2 in % 28
 29
• Using the Signal Analyzer software, perform Data integrity measurements  30
o CMP-Uncompressed-BER-UL-PDSCH0  31
o CMP-Uncompressed-BER-UL-PDSCH1  32
o CMP-Uncompressed-BER-UL-PDSCH2 33
4. Launch “compressed” Test  34
• Via the M-Plane or another suitable mechanism, put the O-RU into a static configuration with the downlink 35
and uplink configured as follows: Fixed point, 9-bit (then 14 bits) 36
• Arm Signal Analyzers and Signal Sources 37
o Arm Signal analyzer to capture the next Frame  38
o Arm Signal Source to generate the Frame NR-FR1-CMP-TST-FRAME-UL 39
• Arm the CUSM emulator to send the TDD O-RAN test frame, including 40
o Downlink: CU-plane of the “Compressed” NR-FR1-TDD-CMP-TST-ST-DL-FPF-9B (then 14B) 41
test stimulus file to the DUT 42
o Uplink: CU-plane of the “Compressed” NR-FR1-TDD-CMP-TST-ST-UL-FPF-9B (then 14B) test 43
stimulus file to the DUT 44
• ARM CUSM-E to capture the Uplink U-Plane Data from the DUT 45
• Launch the test until: 46
o RF Signal Analyzer has captured the downlink frame 47
o CUSM-E has captured the uplink U_plane data 48
5. Compressed Downlink Measurements  49
• With the Signal Analyzer, perform the 3 power measurements  50
o CMP-Compressed-Measured-Power-DL-PDSCH0 in dBm 51
o CMP-Compressed-Measured-Power-DL-PDSCH1 in dBm 52
o CMP-Compressed-Measured-Power-DL-PDSCH2 in dBm 53
• With the Signal Analyzer, perform the 3 EVM measurements  54
o CMP-Compressed-Measured-EVM-DL-PDSCH0 in % 55
o CMP-Compressed-Measured-EVM-DL-PDSCH1 in % 56
o CMP-Compressed-Measured-EVM-DL-PDSCH2 in % 57
• With the Signal Analyzer, check Data integrity measurements  58
o CMP-Compressed-BER-DL-PDSCH0  59
o CMP-Compressed-BER-DL-PDSCH1  60

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       232
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
o CMP-Compressed-BER-DL-PDSCH2 1
6. Validate Downlink conformance conditions  2
• Power measurements within acceptable range  3
o Difference between CMP-Uncompressed-Measured-Power-DL-PDSCH0 and CMP-Compressed-4
Measured-Power-DL-PDSCH0 is within ACC_PWR_PDSCH0 range 5
o Difference between CMP-Uncompressed-Measured-Power-DL-PDSCH1 and CMP-Compressed-6
Measured-Power-DL-PDSCH1 is within ACC_PWR_PDSCH1 range 7
o Difference between CMP-Uncompressed-Measured-Power-DL-PDSCH2 and CMP-Compressed-8
Measured-Power-DL-PDSCH2 is within ACC_PWR_PDSCH2 range 9
• EVM measurements within acceptable range  10
o Difference between CMP-Uncompressed-Measured-EVM-DL-PDSCH0 and CMP-Compressed-11
Measured-EVM-DL-PDSCH0 is less than ACC_EVM_PDSCH0 12
o Difference between CMP-Uncompressed-Measured-EVM-DL-PDSCH1 and CMP-Compressed-13
Measured-EVM-DL-PDSCH1 is less than ACC_EVM_PDSCH1 14
o Difference between CMP-Uncompressed-Measured-EVM-DL-PDSCH2 and CMP-Compressed-15
Measured-EVM-DL-PDSCH2 is less than ACC_EVM_PDSCH2 16
• BER Measurements show no errors  17
o CMP-Uncompressed-BER-DL-PDSCH0 =0 18
o CMP-Uncompressed-BER-DL-PDSCH1 =0 19
o CMP-Uncompressed-BER-DL-PDSCH2 =0 20
o CMP-Compressed-BER-DL-PDSCH0 =0 21
o CMP-Compressed-BER-DL-PDSCH1 =0 22
o CMP-Compressed-BER-DL-PDSCH2 =0 23
7. Compressed Uplink Measurements  24
• Extract IQ information from Capture U-Plane trace 25
• Using the Signal Analyzer software, perform the 3 power measurements  26
o CMP-Compressed-Measured-Power-UL-PDSCH0 in dBm 27
o CMP-Compressed-Measured-Power-UL-PDSCH1 in dBm 28
o CMP-Compressed-Measured-Power-UL-PDSCH2 in dBm 29
• Using the Signal Analyzer software, perform the 3 EVM measurements  30
o CMP-Compressed-Measured-EVM-UL-PDSCH0 in % 31
o CMP-Compressed-Measured-EVM-UL-PDSCH1 in % 32
o CMP-Compressed-Measured-EVM-UL-PDSCH2 in % 33
• Using the Signal Analyzer software, check Data integrity measurements  34
o CMP-Compressed-BER-UL-PDSCH0  35
o CMP-Compressed-BER-UL-PDSCH1  36
o CMP-Compressed-BER-UL-PDSCH2 37
8. Validate Uplink conformance conditions  38
• Validate correct U-Plane PRB header structure  39
o U-Plane udComphdr (per section 6.3.3.13 of [2]) 40
o U-Plane udCompParam (per section 6.3.3.15 of [2]) 41
• Validate that the power measurements within acceptable range  42
o Difference between CMP-Uncompressed-Measured-Power-UL-PDSCH0 and CMP-Compressed-43
Measured-Power-UL-PDSCH0 is within ACC_PWR_PDSCH0 range 44
o Difference between CMP-Uncompressed-Measured-Power-UL-PDSCH1 and CMP-Compressed-45
Measured-Power-UL_PDSCH1 is within ACC_PWR_PDSCH1 range 46
o Difference between CMP-Uncompressed-Measured-Power-UL-PDSCH2 and CMP-Compressed-47
Measured-Power-UL PDSCH2 is within ACC_PWR_PDSCH2 range 48
• Validate EVM measurements within acceptable range  49
o Difference between CMP-Uncompressed-Measured-EVM-UL-PDSCH0 and CMP-Compressed-50
Measured-EVM-UL-PDSCH0 is less than ACC_EVM_PDSCH0 51
o Difference between CMP-Uncompressed-Measured-EVM-UL-PDSCH1 and CMP-Compressed-52
Measured-EVM-UL-PDSCH1 is less than ACC_EVM_PDSCH1 53
o Difference between CMP-Uncompressed-Measured-EVM-UL-PDSCH2 and CMP-Compressed-54
Measured-EVM-UL-PDSCH2 is less than ACC_EVM_PDSCH2 55
• Validate that the BER Measurements show no errors  56
o CMP-Uncompressed-BER-UL-PDSCH0 = 0 57
o CMP-Uncompressed-BER-UL-PDSCH1 = 0 58
o CMP-Uncompressed-BER-UL-PDSCH2 = 0 59
o CMP-Compressed-BER-UL-PDSCH0 = 0 60

o CMP-Compressed-BER-UL-PDSCH1 = 0 1

 TDD UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Compression Static Format (SF) Modulation-23
Compressed Format 24
A. Test Description and Applicability 25
This test is CONDITIONALMANDATORY and shall be performed if the O-RU supports this compression format. 26
 27
This modulation compression format scenario is a static format scenario, based on 3.2.5.3.2 with some important 28
differences 29
• The purpose is to validate Radio Unit’s correct interpretation of the Modulation compression parameters 30
used in the Section Extension Type =4  31
• The test will only verify DL correct encoding of IQ information, as the Modulation Compression model is 32
not applicable for uplink 33
• As the Modulation Compression model does not require IQ bit width to be setup, there is no need to run 34
multiple compression tests for various IQ bit width.  35
• The CUSM_E must generate:  36
 37
Stimulus File Name Description
NR-FR1-TDD-CMP-TST-ST-DL-UNC-16B Static Downlink Uncompressed (CU-plane)
NR-FR1-TDD-CMP-TST-ST-DL-MC Static Downlink Modulation Compression

 TDD UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Compression Static Format (SF) Block Floating 31
Point + Selective RE Format 32
A. Test Description and Applicability 33
This test is CONDITIONALMANDATORY and shall be performed if the O-RU supports this compression format  34
 35
The Block Floating-Point+ Selective RE Format scenario is a static format scenario that will verify DL and UL 36
correct encoding of IQ information for 2 supported bit widths: 9 bits or 14 bits.  37
 38
For this test scenario, the compression test methodology will be based on the description in section 3.2.5.3.1  39
 40
However, on top of the test frame requirements from section 3.2.5.3.1, this test scenario also requires a test frame 41
that MUST include PRBs with a combination of allocated and empty Resource Elements in the same symbol, to 42
verify if the O-RU properly interprets the sReMask value in the udCompParam field (user data compression 43
parameter). The measurements must be performed on the symbols that inc lude a combination of empty and 44
allocated resource elements.  45
 46
The recommended test frame is based on Type 2 DMRS with 2 DMRS CDM groups without data. The resource 47
mapping model for the Resource Blocks is shown on the diagram below, where both symbols #2 and #11 include a 48
combination of empty and allocated Resources. 49
 50

 5

important differences 7
• The purpose is to validate Radio Unit’s correct interpretation of the Modulation compression parameters 8
used in the Section Extension Type =4  9
• The test will only verify Downlink correct encoding of IQ information, as the Modulation Compression 10
model is not applicable for uplink 11
• As the Modulation Compression model does not require IQ bit width to be setup, there is no need to run 12
multiple compression tests for various IQ bit widths.  13
 14
On top of the test frame requirements described above , this test scenario requires a test frame that MUST include 15
PRBs with a combination of allocated and empty Resource Elements in the same symbol, to verify if the O -RU 16
properly interprets the sReMask value in the udCompParam field (user data compression parameter).. The 17
measurements must be performed on the symbols that include a combination of empty and allocated resource 18
elements.  19
 20
The recommended test frame is based on Type 2 DMRS with 2 DMRS CDM groups without data. The resource 21
mapping model for the Resource Blocks is shown on the diagram below, where both symbols #2 and #11 include a 22
combination of empty and allocated Resources. 23

 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Delay Management (DLM) 19
The delay management tests for FR1 TDD Conducted are the same as the tests described in section 3.2.3.4 UC-Plane O-20
RU Scenario Class Delay Management (DLM), except that the TDD waveforms are to be used as shown in 3.2.1.1.3. 21
The tests for uplink and downlink may be executed independently as described in the corresponding FDD test case for 22
Delay Management or the tester may choose to combine the uplink and downlink tests into a single test.  23
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Transport (TRN) 24
This test is for future study. 25
 26

 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class LTE (LTE) 29

waveforms are to be used as shown in Figure 3.2.5.2-1 Combined DL and UL TDD 20 MHz 100 RB. The tests for 31
uplink and downlink may be executed independently as described in the corresponding FDD test case for Delay 32
Management or the tester may choose to combine the uplink and downlink tests into a single test. 33

3.2.6 FR1 and FR2 TDD Non-conducted OTA Signal Tests 1
 2
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class NR testing Generic (NRG)  3
All TDD tests described in this section will be combined UL and DL tests (i.e., a sin gle test frame describing both up 4
link and down link). The default test frame used in this section is described in section 3.2.1.1.3 of this document for 5
FR1 radios and Section 3.2.1.1.4 for FR2 radios.  6
There are several variations on this test signal depending on the capabilities of the radio.  If the radio does not support 7
the numerology used in the example tests as reported in the M-plane it will be up to the test developer to modify their 8
tests to adapt to the radio.  This can usually be accomplished by using stock test patterns described above.  The test is 9
expected to follow the same spirit as the tests in this document but things like symbol numbers, number of PRBs, etc. 10
may have to be changed. 11
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Base 3GPP DL/UL 12
A. Test Description and Applicability 13
This test is MANDATORY. 14
 15
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can meet the most basic uplink and downlink requirements for O -16
RAN fronthaul using a TDD signal.  Subsequent tests will build on this to exercise additional ca pabilities of the 17
Fronthaul. 18
 19
Using the standard TDD test frame described in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4 for FR2, the O -DU emulator 20
(i.e., O-RAN interface of the TER described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that 21
require the O-RU to transmit on the down link and uplink the default signal.   22
 23
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can transmit and receive  a basic 3GPP, TDD test frame using the 24
default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.5 of this document (or a similar 3GPP waveform) except only one spatial 25
stream on one antenna will be used.  This test is applicable for Category A and Category B radios (No precoding is 26
required).  As per section 3.2.1.1.5 all downlink user data in this test will be zeros and all uplink user data will be a 27
PN23 sequence. 28
 29
B. Test Entrance Criteria 30
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4 for FR2 of this document.  31
The test numerology will be 30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described by TM -FR1-32
TM1.1 for FR1 and 120 kHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz bandwidth as described by TM FR2-TM1.1 for 33
FR2.  It will be for 5G New Radio only.  34
 35
 36
C. Test Methodology 37
a. Initial Conditions 38
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation 39
using M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer and 40
signal source to the O-RU antenna ports and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to 41
allow it to synch and demodulate the transmitted signal.   42
b. Procedure 43
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the signal described above in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 44
3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 in the CUSM emulator.  Built the appropriate test frame (uplink slots) for the signal 45
source. Use the CUSM emulator control interface to build the appropriate C -Plane messages that describe 46
the signal. Every symbol used in the test should be described by a single section (DL -SCH that are used for 47
the test, DMRS and DCI) using section type 1 messages. No section type zero messages will be used for 48
this test.  Encapsulate the IQ data in U-Plane messages for downlink slots only. Play those messages to the 49
O-RU respecting timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2.  Repeat the 50
entire frame the number of times required to synch the signal analyzer and allow it to demodulate and 51
decode the test frame.  It will be the responsibility of the TER’s signal analyzer and source to coordinate 52
downlink and uplink TDD transmissions.  The CUSM Emulator of the TER is responsible for receiving 53

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       244
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
uplink U-Plane messages, extracting IQ and decoding it to bits which can be compared to those sent by the 1
signal source. 2
 3
 4
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  5
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for 6
this radio category (i.e., EVM). 7
2. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should be the same as the signal described above.  If it contains 8
all the same PRB assignments and all zero data, the test passes. 9
 10
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended 3GPP DL/UL – Resource Allocation 11
A. Test Description and Applicability 12
This test is MANDATORY. 13
 14
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can meet the extended uplink and downlink requirements for O -RAN 15
fronthaul using a TDD signal.  This test modifies the previous test by using a PN23 sequence in all test PDSCH 16
sections. 17
 18
Using the standard TDD test frame described in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 the O-DU emulator 19
(i.e., O-RAN interface of the TER described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that 20
require the O-RU to transmit on the down link and uplink the default signal.   21
 22
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can transmit and receive  an extended 3GPP TDD test frame using 23
the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 of this document (or a similar 3GPP 24
waveform) except only one spatial stream on one antenna will be used.  This test is applicable for Category A and 25
Category B radios (No precoding is required).  All downlink user data in this  test will be a PN23 sequence and all 26
uplink user data will also be a PN23 sequence. 27
 28
B. Test Entrance Criteria 29
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 of this document.  30
The test numerology will be 30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described by TM-FR1-31
TM1.1 for FR1 and 120 kHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz bandwidth as described by TM FR2 -TM1.1 for 32
FR2.  It will be for 5G New Radio only.  33
 34
 35
C. Test Methodology 36
a. Initial Conditions 37
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation 38
using M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the 39
O-RU antenna port and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and 40
demodulate the transmitted signal.   41
b. Procedure 42
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the signal described above in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 43
3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 in the CUSM emulator. In this case use a PN23 sequence for the downlink shared 44
channel.  Build the appropriate test frame (uplink slots) for the signal source. Use the CUSM emulator 45
control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that describe the uplink and downlink signals. 46
Every symbol used in the test should be described by a single section (DL -SCH that are used for the test, 47
DMRS and DCI) using section type 1 messages. No section type zero messages will be used for this test.  48
Encapsulate the IQ data in U-Plane messages for downlink slots only. Play those messages to the O-RU 49
respecting timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2.  Repeat the entire 50
frame the number of times required to synch the signal analyzer and allow it to demodulate and decode the 51
test frame.  It will be the responsibility of the TER’s signal analyzer and source to coordinate downlink and 52
uplink TDD transmissions.  The CUSM Emulator of the TER is responsible for receiving uplink U-Plane 53
messages, extracting IQ and decoding it to bits which can be compared to those sent by the signal source.  54
 55
 56

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       245
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  1
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for 2
this radio category (i.e., EVM). 3
2. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should be the same as the signal described above.  If it contains 4
all the same PRB assignments and all zero data, the test passes. 5
 6
 7
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended using SymInc parameter 3GPP DL/UL – 8
Resource Allocation 9
A. Test Description and Applicability 10
This test is CONDITIONAL MANDATORY. 11
 12
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can accurately interpret C-Plane resource allocation messages with 13
the SymInc parameter set, transfer U-Plane data into the correct resource blocks and transmit this data accurately in 14
the downlink and interpret and capture the correct resource blocks in the uplink with the SymInc parameter set.    15
This test uses a PN23 sequence in all test PDSCH sections. 16
 17
Using the standard TDD test frame described in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 the O -DU emulator 18
(i.e., O-RAN interface of the TER described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that 19
require the O-RU to transmit on the down link and uplink the specified signal using the SymInc bit in both uplink 20
and downlink.   21
 22
Only one spatial stream on one antenna will be used.  This test is applicable for Category A and Category B radios 23
(No precoding is required).  All downlink user data in this test will be a PN23 sequence and all uplink user data 24
will also be a PN23 sequence. 25
 26
B. Test Entrance Criteria 27
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 of this document.  28
The test numerology will be 30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described by TM-FR1-TM1.1   29
for FR1 and 120 kHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz bandwidth as described by TM FR2-TM1.1 for FR2.  It will 30
be for 5G New Radio only.  31
 32
The radio must support the SymInc Parameter as notified by the M-Plane.  The Signal Analyzer must have the 33
ability to decode the downlink shared channel. 34
 35
 36
C. Test Methodology 37
a. Initial Conditions 38
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation 39
using M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the 40
O-RU antenna port and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and 41
demodulate the transmitted signal.  Connect the signal source to the O -RU antenna port and configure it as 42
described below. 43
b. Procedure 44
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the signal described above in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 45
3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 in the CUSM emulator. In this case use a PN23 sequence for the downlink shared 46
channel.  Build the appropriate test frame (uplink slots) for the signal source. Use the CUSM emulator 47
control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that describe the uplink and downlink signals. 48
Every symbol used in the test should be described by a single section (DL -SCH that are used for the test, 49
DMRS and DCI) using section type 1 messages. No section type zero messages will be used for this test.  50
Encapsulate the IQ data in U-Plane messages for downlink slots only. Play those messages to the O-RU 51
respecting timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2.  Repeat the ent ire 52
frame the number of times required to synch the signal analyzer and allow it to demodulate and decode the 53
test frame.  It will be the responsibility of the TER’s signal analyzer and source to coordinate downlink and 54
uplink TDD transmissions.  The CUSM Emulator of the TER is responsible for receiving uplink U-Plane 55
messages, extracting IQ and decoding it to bits which can be compared to those sent by the signal source.  56
 57

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       246
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
 1
For the downlink slots and symbols: Every symbol should be described by a single type 1 section (DL-2
SCH and DCI) except symbols #5 and #6 which will be used for the SymInc test. The data in these sections 3
must be a PN23 sequence using an initial seed of all ones. Each symbol should be a new PN23 sequence, 4
that is PRB 0 should contain the data from a new PN23 sequence for each symbol. Symbols number 5 and 5
6 should be stock data sections type “E” as shown above.  This stock data section consists of two adjacent 6
symbols each containing two sections.  The corresponding C-Plane message will contain 4 section IDs in a 7
single C-Plane message describing symbols #5 and #6.  The startSymbolId in the application header will be 8
symbol #5. The second section ID for symbol #5 will have the SymInc bit set informing the O -RU that the 9
next section will begin describing symbol #6. The corresponding U-Plane messages will be a new PN23 10
sequence for each symbol (5 and 6). Additional sections should be included to describe the DCI symbols as 11
well as Reference Signals described in 38.141-1.  12
 13
For the uplink sections and symbols: Load uplink test waveform  on the RF Signal Source.  Note this 14
signal has a PN23 sequence as user data.  Configure the source to generate a new PN23 sequence in 15
symbols #5 and #6.  Configure the Signal Source to play test waveforms on 10ms frame boundaries starting 16
when it receives a trigger signal from the O-DU emulator that all C-Plane messages have been sent.  Ensure 17
the O-RU and source are synchronized so downlink slots do not conflict with uplink slots.  Load C -Plane 18
message sequence on Test Equipment O-RU (TER) – Only symbols #5 and #6 in each slot will be used in 19
this test. All other symbols will contain either reference signals or data but will not be considered part of 20
the test.  These two symbols will be used to determine whether the radio properly increments the current 21
symbol ID when the SymInc bit is set. The C-Plane message for symbol #5 should have the SymInc bit set.  22
This message should have a second section describing symbol #6 (using the SymInc mechanism).  All 23
PRBs in each symbol will be requested (In the example waveform 51 PRBs).  24
 25
Steps: 26
• Arm Test Equipment O-RU (TER) to capture DUT fronthaul Messages  27
• Launch test to play the C-Plane messages and the downlink U-Plane messages and trigger the 28
source to play the RF signal on a frame boundary.  29
• Play messages to the O-RU respecting the timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 30
3.2.1.1.4  for FR2.  Repeat the entire frame the number of times required to synch the signal 31
analyzer and allow it to demodulate and decode the frame. 32
• Record U-Plane messages from DUT for a complete frame and the eAxC corresponding to the 33
Antenna port  34
• Extract IQ information from the captured U-Plane messages 35
• Extract IQ information from the signal analyzer for downlink slots 36
• Extract Payload for both signals 37
• Compare payload binary sequences  38
 39
 40
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  41
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for 42
this radio category (i.e., EVM). 43
2. The signal extracted by the U-Plane messages (uplink) should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance 44
requirement for this radio category (i.e., EVM). 45
3. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should be the same as the signal described above.  If it 46
contains all the same PRB assignments and the correct PN23 data, the downlink test passes.  47
4. The test frame extracted from the uplink U-Plane messages should be the same as the uplink signal 48
described above.  If it contains all the same PRB assignments and correct PN 23 data, the uplink test passes. 49
 50
 51

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       247
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended using reMask parameter 3GPP DL/UL – 1
Resource Allocation 2
A. Test Description and Applicability 3
This test is MANDATORY. 4
 5
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can accurately interpret C-Plane resource allocation messages with 6
the reMask parameter set, transfer U-Plane data into the correct resource blocks and transmit this data accurately in 7
the downlink and interpret and capture the correct resource blocks in the uplink with the reMask parameter set.    8
This test uses a PN23 sequence in all test PDSCH sections. 9
 10
Using the standard TDD test frame described in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 the O -DU emulator 11
(i.e., O-RAN interface of the TER described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that 12
require the O-RU to transmit on the down link and uplink the specified signal using the rb bit in both uplink and 13
downlink.   14
 15
Only one spatial stream on one antenna will be used.  This test is applicable for Category A and Category B radios 16
(No precoding is required).  All downlink user data in this test will be a PN23 sequence and all uplink user data 17
will also be a PN23 sequence. 18
 19
B. Test Entrance Criteria 20
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 of this document.  21
The test numerology will be 30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described by TM-FR1-TM1.1   22
for FR1 and 120 kHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz bandwidth as described by TM FR2 -TM1.1 for FR2.  It will 23
be for 5G New Radio only.  24
 25
The radio must support the reMask Parameter as notified by the M-Plane.  The Signal Analyzer must have the 26
ability to decode the downlink shared channel. 27
 28
C. Test Methodology 29
a. Initial Conditions 30
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation 31
using M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the 32
O-RU antenna port and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and 33
demodulate the transmitted signal.  Connect the signal source to the O -RU antenna port and configure it as 34
described below. 35
b. Procedure 36
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the signal described above in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 37
3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 in the CUSM emulator. In this case use a PN23 sequence for the downlink shared 38
channel.  Build the appropriate test frame (uplink slots) for the signal source. Use the CUSM emulator 39
control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that describe the uplink and downlink signals. 40
Every symbol used in the test should be described by a single section (DL -SCH that are used for the test, 41
DMRS and DCI) using section type 1 messages. No section type zero messages will be used for this test.  42
Encapsulate the IQ data in U-Plane messages for downlink slots only. Play those messages to the O-RU 43
respecting timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2.  Repeat the ent ire 44
frame the number of times required to synch the signal analyzer and allow it to demodulate and decode the 45
test frame.  It will be the responsibility of the TER’s signal analyzer and source to coordinate downlink and 46
uplink TDD transmissions.  The CUSM Emulator of the TER is responsible for receiving uplink U-Plane 47
messages, extracting IQ and decoding it to bits which can be compared to those sent by the signal source.  48
 49
For the downlink slots and symbols: Symbol number 6 should be stock data section type “D” as shown 50
above.  This test will only be using PRBs 1 through 5.  The corresponding C -Plane message will contain a 51
section IDs in a single C-Plane message describing symbol #6.  The startSymbolId in the application header 52
will be symbol #6. The C-Plane message will have one section with the reMask set to only the odd number 53
resource elements.  The number of PRBs will be 4. The start PRB will be 1.  54
 55
The corresponding U-Plane message will be a new PN23 Sequence (initial seed is all ones) in PRBs 1 56
through 5 of symbol #6. 57
 58

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       248
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
For the uplink sections and symbols: Load C-Plane message sequence on Test Equipment O-RU (TER) 1
symbol #5 in each slot will be used to determine whether the radio properly transmits only every other 2
resource element when the reMask is set. No other symbols will be used in this test, however other symbols 3
containing reference signals should be used to ensure the O-RU can synchronize with the TER.  The TER 4
will not request any other symbols from the O-RU in this test.  The C-Plane message for symbol #5 should 5
have the reMask set to tell the radio to send only every odd resource element. Only the PRBs 1 through 5 6
will be used in this section (matching stock data section type “D”). The number of PRBs will be 4 and the 7
start PRB will be 1. 8
 9
Steps: 10
• Arm Test Equipment O-RU (TER) to capture DUT fronthaul Messages  11
• Launch test to play the C-Plane messages and the downlink U-Plane messages and trigger the 12
source to play the RF signal on a frame boundary.  13
• Play messages to the O-RU respecting the timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 14
3.2.1.1.4  for FR2.  Repeat the entire frame the number of times required to synch the signal 15
analyzer and allow it to demodulate and decode the frame. 16
• Record U-Plane messages from DUT for a complete frame and the eAxC corresponding to the 17
Antenna port  18
• Extract IQ information from the captured U-Plane messages 19
• Extract IQ information from the signal analyzer for downlink slots 20
• Extract Payload for both signals 21
• Compare payload binary sequences  22
 23
 24
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  25
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for 26
this radio category (i.e., EVM). 27
2. The signal extracted by the U-Plane messages (uplink) should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance 28
requirement for this radio category (i.e., EVM). 29
3. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should be the same as the signal described above.  If it 30
contains all the same PRB assignments and the correct PN23 sequence as data, the downlink test passes. 31
4. The test frame extracted from the uplink U-Plane messages should be the same as the uplink signal 32
described above.  If it contains all the same PRB assignments and the correct PN23 sequence as data, the 33
uplink test passes. 34
 35
 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended using RB parameter 3GPP DL/UL – 36
Resource Allocation 37
A. Test Description and Applicability 38
This test is MANDATORY. 39
 40
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can accurately interpret C-Plane resource allocation messages with 41
the rb parameter set, transfer U-Plane data into the correct resource blocks and transmit this data accurately in the 42
downlink and interpret and capture the correct resource blocks in the uplink with the rb parameter set.    This test 43
uses a PN23 sequence in all test PDSCH sections. 44
 45
Using the standard TDD test frame described in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 the O -DU emulator 46
(i.e., O-RAN interface of the TER described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that 47
require the O-RU to transmit on the down link and uplink the specified signal using the rb bit in both uplink and 48
downlink.   49
 50
Only one spatial stream on one antenna will be used.  This test is applicable for Category A and Category B radios 51
(No precoding is required).  All downlink user data in this test will be a PN23 sequence and all uplink user data 52
will also be a PN23 sequence. 53
 54
B. Test Entrance Criteria 55
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 of this document.  56
The test numerology will be 30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described by TM-FR1-57

________________________________________________________________________________________________
Copyright © 2021 by the O-RAN ALLIANCE e.V.
Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       249
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
TM1.1 for FR1 and 120 kHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz bandwidth as described by TM FR2-TM1.1 for 1
FR2.  It will be for 5G New Radio only.  2
 3
C. Test Methodology 4
a. Initial Conditions 5
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation 6
using M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the 7
O-RU antenna port and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and 8
demodulate the transmitted signal.  Connect the signal source to the O -RU antenna port and configure it as 9
described below. 10
b. Procedure 11
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the signal described above in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 12
3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 in the CUSM emulator. In this case use a PN23 sequence for the downlink shared 13
channel.  Build the appropriate test frame (uplink slots) for the signal source. Use the CUSM emulator 14
control interface to build the appropriate C-Plane messages that describe the uplink and downlink signals. 15
Every symbol used in the test should be described by a single section (DL -SCH that are used for the test, 16
DMRS and DCI) using section type 1 messages. No section type zero messages will be used for this test.  17
Encapsulate the IQ data in U-Plane messages for downlink slots only. Play those messages to the O-RU 18
respecting timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2.  Repeat the ent ire 19
frame the number of times required to synch the signal analyzer and allow it to demodulate and decode the 20
test frame.  It will be the responsibility of the TER’s signal analyzer and source to coordinate downlink and 21
uplink TDD transmissions.  The CUSM Emulator of the TER is responsible for receiving uplink U-Plane 22
messages, extracting IQ and decoding it to bits which can be compared to those sent by the signal source.  23
 24
For the downlink slots and symbols: Every allocated (see below) symbol should be described by a single 25
section (DL-SCH and DCI) using section type 1 messages. No section type zero messages will be used for 26
this test.  Symbol #3 of each downlink slot should be Stock data section type  “D” as shown in section 27
3.2.1.1.5 above. The control plane message for symbol #3 will only include PRBs number 5 through 23.  28
This C-Plane message will have the rb bit set to one for this section. All other DL-SCH symbols will not 29
contain data except required reference signals needed to synchronize the signal analyzer.  Encapsulate the 30
IQ data in U-Plane messages. U-Plane data in symbol #3 will include a new PN23 sequence starting with 31
an initial seed of all ones starting in PRB number 5. Additional sections should be included to describe the 32
DCI symbols as well as Reference Signals described in TS 38.141-1.  33
 34
For the uplink sections and symbols: Load uplink test waveform  on the RF Signal Source.  Note this 35
signal has a PN23 sequence as user data.  Configure the Signal Source to play the  TDD test waveforms on 36
10ms frame boundaries starting when it receives a trigger signal from the O -DU emulator that all C-Plane 37
messages have been sent.  Ensure the O-RU and source are synchronized so downlink slots do not conflict 38
with uplink slots. Load C-Plane message sequence on Test Equipment O-RU (TER) – This C-Plane 39
sequence should describe a single section per uplink symbol (51 RBs per symbol).  The C -Plane message 40
for uplink symbol #6 should have the rb bit set.  All other sections should have the r b bit set to zero.  41
 42
 43
Steps: 44
• Arm Test Equipment O-RU (TER) to capture DUT fronthaul Messages  45
• Launch test to play the C-Plane messages and the downlink U-Plane messages and trigger the 46
source to play the RF signal on a frame boundary.  47
• Play messages to the O-RU respecting the timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 48
3.2.1.1.4  for FR2.  Repeat the entire frame the number of times required to synch the signal 49
analyzer and allow it to demodulate and decode the frame. 50
• Record U-Plane messages from DUT for a complete frame and the eAxC corresponding to the 51
Antenna port  52
• Extract IQ information from the captured U-Plane messages 53
• Extract IQ information from the signal analyzer for downlink slots 54
• Extract Payload for both signals 55
• Compare payload binary sequences  56

 UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended using Non-contiguous PRB Allocation 13
Section Extension 3GPP DL/UL – Resource Allocation 14
 15
A. Test Description and Applicability 16
This test is CONDITIONAL MANDATORY. 17
 18
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can accurately interpret C-Plane resource allocation messages with 19
section extension 6, transfer U-Plane data into the correct resource blocks and transmit this data accurately in the 20
downlink and interpret and capture the correct resource blocks in the uplink with section extension 6.    This test 21
uses a PN23 sequence in all test PDSCH sections. 22
 23
Using the standard TDD test frame described in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 the O -DU emulator 24
(i.e., O-RAN interface of the TER described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that 25
require the O-RU to transmit on the down link and uplink the specified signal using section extension 6 in both 26
uplink and downlink.   27
 28
In this test stock data section definition C will be used to exercise the non -contiguous RB allocation, all 273 PRBs 29
(51 in the uplink slots)or the max number of PRBs per symbol for the highest numerology the radio supports will 30
be used in this test. 31
 32
Only one spatial stream on one antenna will be used.  This test is applicable for Category A and Category B radios 33
(No precoding is required).  All downlink user data in this test will be a PN23 sequence and all uplink user data 34
will also be a PN23 sequence. 35
 36
B. Test Entrance Criteria 37
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.3 for FR1 or 3.2.1.1.4  for FR2 of this document.  38
The test numerology will be 30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described by TM-FR1-TM1.1  39
for FR1 and 120 kHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz bandwidth as described by TM FR2 -TM1.1 for FR2.  It will 40
be for 5G New Radio only.  41
 42
The radio must support section extension 6 as notified by the M-Plane.  The Signal Analyzer must have the ability 43
to decode the downlink shared channel. 44
 45

 UC- Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended 3GPP DL/UL – Resource Allocation – 1
Coupling C and U plane via time and frequency 2
A. Test Description and Applicability 3
This test is CONDITIONAL MANDATORY. 4
 5
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can meet the extended uplink and downlink requirements for O-RAN 6
fronthaul using a TDD signal.  This test uses time and frequency to couple C-Plane and U-Plane messages. 7
 8
Using the standard TDD test frame described in section 3.2.1.1.3 the O-DU emulator (i.e., O-RAN interface of the 9
TER described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that require the O-RU to transmit on the 10
down link and uplink the default signal.   11
 12
The purpose of this test is to ensure the radio can transmit and receive  an extended 3GPP TDD test frame using 13
the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.3 of this document (or a similar 3GPP waveform) except only one spatial 14
stream on one antenna will be used.  This test is applicable for Category A and Category B radios (No precoding 15
is required).  All downlink user data in this test will be a PN23 sequence and all uplink user data will also be a 16
PN23 sequence. The radio must report over the M-Plane that it supports C and U plane coupling via time and 17
frequency. 18
 19
B. Test Entrance Criteria 20
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.3 of this document.  The test numerology will be 21
30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described by TM-FR1-TM1.1.  It will be for 5G New 22
Radio only. The radio must report over the M-Plane that it supports C and U plane coupling via time and 23
frequency. 24
 25
The O-RU must have a conducted antenna port (or TAB connector) to be connected to a signal analyzer and signal 26
source.  It must also support the default parameters defined in section 3.2.1.1.1 above. 27
 28
C. Test Methodology 29
a. Initial Conditions 30
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation 31
using M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the 32
O-RU antenna port and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and 33
demodulate the transmitted signal.   34
b. Procedure 35
Build an appropriate IQ signal describing the signal described above in section 3.2.1.1.3 in the CUSM 36
emulator. In this case use a PN23 sequence for the downlink shared channel.  Build the appropriate test 37
frame (uplink slots) for the signal source. Use the CUSM emulator control interface to build the appropriate 38
C-Plane messages that describe the uplink and downlink signals. Every symbol used in the test should be 39
described by a single section (DL-SCH that are used for the test, DMRS and DCI) using section type 1 40
messages. No section type zero messages will be used for this test.  Encapsulate the IQ data in U-Plane 41
messages for downlink slots only. Play those messages to the O-RU respecting timing windows described 42
in section 3.2.1.1.1.  Repeat the entire frame the number of times required to synch the signal analyzer and 43
allow it to demodulate and decode the test frame.  It will be the responsibility of the TER’s signal analyzer 44
and source to coordinate downlink and uplink TDD transmissions.  The CUSM Emulator of the TER is 45
responsible for receiving uplink U-Plane messages, extracting IQ and decoding it to bits which can be 46
compared to those sent by the signal source.  All section IDs in C-Plane messages and downlink U-Plane 47
messages must be 4095. 48
 49
C-Plane and Downlink U-Plane messages sent by the TER will have valid values in the following fields: 50
• EAxC ID 51
• Datadirection bit  52
• Frame ID, subframeID, slotID, startsymbolID, and NumSymbol 53
• SectionID must have a value 4095 54
• SymInc, rb reMask and section extension #6 are not used in this test 55
 56
It is the responsibility of the TER to properly arrange uplink U-Plane messages using only time and 57
frequency resources. 58
 59

Your use is subject to the terms of the O-RAN Adopter License Agreement in the Annex ZZZ.       254
                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  1
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for 2
this radio category (i.e., EVM). 3
2. All received U-Plane messages must have section ID equal to 4095 4
3. The test frame received by the signal analyzer should be the same as the signal described above.  If it contains 5
all the same PRB assignments and all zero data, the test passes. 6

 UC- Plane O-RU Scenario Class Extended 3GPP DL/UL – Coupling C and U plane via 8
Time and Frequency and Section Description Priorities 9
A. Test Description and Applicability 10
This test is CONDITIONAL MANDATORY. 11
 12
The purpose of this test is to test whether the radio can implement coupling U and C plane via time and frequency 13
and section description priorities requirements for O-RAN fronthaul using a TDD signal.  This test combines the 14
FDD, uplink and downlink tests for these same features. 15
 16
Starting with the standard TDD test frame described in section 3.2.1.1.3  the O-DU emulator (i.e., O-RAN interface 17
of the TER described in section 2.1) will generate C-Plane and U-Plane messages that require the O-RU to transmit 18
on the down link and uplink the signals described below.   19
 20
Only one spatial stream on one antenna will be used.  This test is applicable for Category A and Category B radios 21
(No precoding is required).  All downlink user data in this test will be a PN23 sequence and all uplink user data 22
will also be a PN23 sequence. 23
 24
B. Test Entrance Criteria 25
The O-RU must support the default parameters in section 3.2.1.1.3 of this document and those specified below.  26
The test numerology will be 30 KHz subcarrier spacing and 100 MHz Bandwidth as described by TM-FR1-27
TM1.1.  It will be for 5G New Radio only. The radio must have conducted antenna ports (FR1) or TAB 28
connectors.  It will be a TDD signal. 29
 30
The O-RU must have a conducted antenna port (or TAB connector) to be connected to a signal analyzer and signal 31
source.  It must also support the default parameters defined in section 3.2.1.1.1 above. 32
 33
C. Test Methodology 34
a. Initial Conditions 35
Configure the O-RU which includes collecting O-RU capabilities, configuring the O-RU for operation 36
using M-Plane commands, and synchronizing the O-RU using G.8275.1.  Connect the signal analyzer to the 37
O-RU antenna port and configure the analyzer with any set-up information needed to allow it to synch and 38
demodulate the transmitted signal.   39
b. Procedure 40
Build an appropriate C and U plane signals for the signals described below in the CUSM emulator. Every 41
slot used in the test should be described by a single C-Plane message with multiple sections (DL-SCH that 42
are used for the test, DMRS and DCI) using a section type 1 message. No section type zero messages will 43
be used for this test.  Encapsulate the IQ data in U-Plane messages for downlink slots only. Play those 44
messages to the O-RU respecting timing windows described in section 3.2.1.1.1.  Repeat the entire frame 45
the number of times required to synch the signal analyzer and allow it to demodulate and decode the test 46
frame.  It will be the responsibility of the TER’s signal analyzer and source to coordinate downlink and 47
uplink TDD transmissions.  The CUSM Emulator of the TER is responsible for receiving uplink U -Plane 48
messages, extracting IQ and decoding it to bits which can be compared to those sent by the signal source.  49
 50
• Downlink procedure: 51

Table 3.2.5.8-3  Time and Frequency Coupling with Priority TDD DL 1
 2
In this test the section configuration will be as shown in Table 3.2.5.1-3 above.  The 6 sections will comprise 3
one slot and this slot will be repeated continuously in the downlink slots in the TDD frame to synchronize the 4
TER signal analyzer.  The six sections will be sent on one C-Plane message using C and U plane coupling 5
via time and frequency.  The configuration above follows the example given in the CUSM specification.  6
The section numbers in the above table do not represent SectionID numbers but individual secti ons. Sections 7
#1 and #2 describe hypothetical DMRS signals sent in symbols #2 and #11 in each slot.  These signals have 8
every other subcarrier masked by reMask. This is the same as shown above in the standard NR-FR1-TM1.1 9
test signal shown above. The DMRS signals in symbol #2 have beam ID 1 and symbol #11 have beam ID 2.  10
These sections use section extension 6 and contain a higher priority than all other sections.  11
Section #3 describes PN23 data sent to hypothetical UE #1 it overlaps REs in sections #1 and #2 but has a 12
lower priority so sections #1 and #2 are valid.  Since section #3 has contiguous symbols section extension 6 13
is not needed. 14
Section #4 is for hypothetical UE #2. It occupies the same symbols as the DMRS signals but uses a different 15
reMask.  Since the symbols are not contiguous it uses sections extension 6 but the priority is set to the default 16
0. 17
Section #5 is for hypothetical UE #3 and uses a contiguous set of symbols so section extension 6 is not 18
needed.  It does not overlap any other signals.  This section is optional because it does not test Section 19
Description Priority. 20
Section #6 is a hypothetical special channel using only one symbol and does not require section extension 6.  21
This section is also optional. 22
U-Plane messages will contain: 23
• DMRS signals for every odd resource element as described by section #1 for symbol #11  24
• DMRS signals for every odd resource element as described by section #2 for symbol #2  25

                                                                                        O-RAN.WG4.CONF.0-v03.00
• A new PN23 sequence in each of the first 5 symbols as described in section #3.  Note t hat for 1
symbol #2 the PN sequence will be pierced by the DMRS signals. 2
• A new PN23 sequence for symbol #6 as described by section #4 as well as a new PN sequence for 3
symbol #11.  These sequences are only 32 PRBs long and start in PRB 15. The sequence in symbol 4
#11 will be pierced by DMRS signals. 5
• The user data for sections number #5 and #6 are standard PN23 sequences only for these symbols 6
and PRBs described in the table above. 7
 8
• Uplink Procedure: 9
Build the following Uplink C-Plane message. 10
Start with a standard as G-FR1-A1-5 waveform.  Define the sections shown in table X.Y.Z.  These 11
sections are described below. 12

In this test the section configuration will be as shown in Table 3.2.5.1-4 above.  The 6 sections will 17
comprise one slot and this slot will be repeated to fill the entire frame (i.e., 20 times).  The six sections 18
will be sent on one C-Plane message using C and U plane coupling via time and frequency.  The 19
configuration above follows the example given in the CUSM specification.  20
o The section numbers in the above table do not represent SectionID numbers but individual sections. 21
Sections #1 and #2 describe hypothetical DMRS signals sent in symbols #2 and #11 in each slot.  22
These signals have every other subcarrier masked by reMask. This is the same as shown above in 23
the standard G-FR1-A1-5 test signal shown above with the exception that the DMRS signals 24
continue for all 273 RBs. The DMRS signals in symbol #2 have beam ID 1 and symbol #11 have 25
beam ID 2.  These sections use section extension 6 and contain a higher priority than a ll other 26
sections.  27

o Section #3 describes PN23 data sent to hypothetical UE #1 it overlaps REs in sections #1 and #2 1
but has a lower priority so sections #1 and #2 are valid.  Since section #3 has contiguous symbols 2
section extension 6 is not needed.  Note it starts in PRM 64 (RBG 4) and continues for the 3
remainder of the 273 RBs. 4
o Section #4 is for hypothetical UE #2. It occupies the same symbols as the DMRS signals but uses a 5
different reMask.  Since the symbols are not contiguous it uses sections extension  6 but the priority 6
is set to the default 0.  It also starts in RBG 4 (RB 64) and continues to the rest of the 273 RBs.  7
o Section #5 is for hypothetical UE #3 and uses a contiguous set of symbols so section extension 6 is 8
not needed.  It does not overlap any other signals.  This section is optional because it does not test 9
Section Description Priority. 10
o Section #6 is a hypothetical special channel using only one symbol and does not require section 11
extension 6.  This section is also optional. 12
• Load the following waveform into the signal source: 13
o DMRS signals for every odd resource element as described by section #1 for symbol #11  14
o DMRS signals for every odd resource element as described by section #2 for symbol #2  15
o A new PN23 sequence in each of the first 5 symbols as described in section #3.  Note that for 16
symbol #2 the PN sequence will be pierced by the DMRS signals. 17
o A new PN23 sequence for symbol #6 as described by section #4 as well as a new PN sequence for 18
symbol #11.  These sequences start in PRB 64 and continue to PRB 273. The sequence in symbol 19
#11 will be pierced by DMRS signals. 20
o The user data for sections number #5 and #6 are standard PN23 sequences only for these symbols 21
and PRBs described in the table above. 22
• Configure Signal Source to play test waveforms on 10ms frame boundaries starting when it receives a 23
trigger signal from the O-DU emulator that C-Plane messages have been sent. 24
• Load C-Plane message described above on Test Equipment O-RU (TER). The C-Plane message will 25
contain valid values in the following fields: 26
• EAxC ID 27
• Datadirection bit (Uplink) 28
• Frame ID, subframeID, slotID, startsymbolID, and NumSymbol 29
• SectionID must have a value 4095 30
• Arm Test Equipment O-RU (TER) to capture DUT fronthaul Messages  31
• Launch test to play the RF uplink frame after the C-Plane messages have been sent honoring timing 32
windows  33
• Record U-Plane messages from DUT for a complete frame and the eAxC corresponding to the Antenna 34
port  35
• TER will arrange U-Plane messages according to time and frequency 36
• Extract IQ information  37
• Extract Payload 38
• Compare payload binary sequences  39
 40
 41
D. Test Requirement (expected result)  42
1. The signal measured by the signal analyzer should satisfy a basic 3GPP signal performance requirement for 43
this radio category (i.e., EVM). 44
2. The test frame received by the signal analyzer must be the same as the signal described above.  It must contain 45
all the same PRB assignments and PN23 sequences. 46
3. The data received from the O-RU on the uplink U-Plane must match the uplink signal sent to the DUT 47
including all the same PRB assignments and PN23 sequences. 48
4. The beamweights or magnitude and phase relation at the antenna ports (or TAB connectors) of the test signal 49
that achieves the highest performance (i.e. best EVM, power, SNR, etc.) should match with the manufacturer’s 50
declaration of the beam under test.  The procedures for test case 3.2.3.2.4 (UC-Plane O-RU Scenario Class 51
Beamforming 3GPP UL – Predefined-beam Beamforming) and test case 3.2.3.2.3 (UC-Plane O-RU Scenario 52
Class Beamforming 3GPP DL – Predefined-beam Beamforming) should be used. 53
5. If all of the above results are observed the test passes. 54
